children.definition: absolute prudence, Him. Ecl. 32.12.
Ion Trag. [53f] ap. Lex.Sabb.
self-grown, στρωμνὴ οἰκεία τε καὶ αὐ., of the fur of beasts, Pl. Prt. 321a; self-existent, Critias 19.1 D.
self-grown, of home production, ἀγαθά X. Vect. 2.1; ὦ πόλι φίλη Κέκροπος, αὐτοφυὲς Ἀττική Ar. Fr. 110.

data.quote: ὦ πόλι φίλη Κέκροπος, αὐτοφυὲς Ἀττική

children.definition: natural, opp. artificial, οὐδός Hes. Th. 813; λιμήν Th. 1.93; χρυσὸς αὐ. native gold, D.S. 3.45; κύανος αὐ. Thphr. Lap. 39; αὐ. λόφοι hills in their natural state, not quarried or mined, X. Vect. 4.2; κορύναν αὐτοφυῆ a natural growth, Theoc. 9.24; opp. χειροποίητος, Plb. 9.27.4; opp. τὰ διὰ τέχνης, wild, not cultivable, Thphr. CP 3.1.1; of a horse, τὸν αὐτοφυῆ (sc. δρόμον) διατροχάζειν to have natural paces, X. Eq. 7.11; αὐ. γηρύματα ‘ native wood-notes wild’, of birds, opp. language, Plu. Sollert. 2.973a; of style, natural, simple, D.H. Din. 7; αὐ. αἴσθησις, opp. ἐπιστημονική, Phld. Mus. p.11 K., cf. p.63 K.: Comp. -έστερος more natural, of an explanation, Simp. in Ph. 149.18. Adv. -φυῶς, ὅμοιον like by nature, opp. μιμητής, Pl. Grg. 513b; αὐ. ἀγαθοί Id. Lg. 642c.
τὸ αὐ. oneʼs own nature, Id. R. 486e; natural state, opp. τὸ ἐπίκτητον, Arist. Rh. 1365a29.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., bearing, producing of itself, γῆ αὐ. ὧν φέρει Philostr. Im. 2.18. Adv. -φυῶς spontaneously, Syrian. in Metaph. 123.22; αὐ. κινούμενοι Plot. 6.5.1.
abstract nature, Phlp. in de An. 99.16.
self-engendered: hence, arising naturally, ἕλκεα Pi. P. 3.47, cf. Antipho Trag. ap. Lex.Sabb.; native, ἀρετή D.C. 44.37.
natural, primitive, ἐργασία Arist. Pol. 1256a40.
direct utterance, title of work on oracles by Oenomaus, Jul. Or. 7.209b.
self-sounding, χρησμὸς αὐ. an oracle delivered by the god himself, Luc. Alex. 26.
self-betrayed, self-revealed, S.E. M. 8.173.

definition: αὐτοφωρίᾳ ( -φορία cod.) · τὸ ἐπὶ αὐτῇ φωρᾷ ( φορᾷ cod.), Hsch.

children.definition: self-detected, ἀμπλακήματα S. Ant. 51.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἐπʼ αὐτοφώρῳ λαμβάνειν to catch in the act, Lys. 13.85, D. 19.132; ἑλεῖν E. Ion 1214; ἐλέγχειν Lys. 7.42: with pass. Verbs, ἐπʼ αὐτοφώρῳ ἁλῶναι Hdt. 6.72; εἰλῆφθαι Ar. Pl. 455, Eup. 181: hence,

notoriously, manifestly, ἐπιβουλεύοντας φανῆναι ἐπʼ αὐ. Hdt. 6.137; ἐπʼ αὐ. αὐτὸν ἐλέγξω Lys. 13.30; τὸν θάνατόν τινος ἐπ. αὐ. μηχανωμένη Antipho 1.3; ἐπʼ αὐ. καταλαμβάνειν τινὰ ἀμαθέστερον ὄντα Pl. Ap. 22b, cf. R. 359c; ἐπʼ αὐ. εἴλημμαι πλουσιώτατος ὤν X. Smp. 3.13; ἀξιῶ σε . . ἐπʼ. αὐ. ταῦτά μοι ἐπιδεῖξαι Lys. 1.21; ἐπʼ αὐ. κλέπται ὄντες ἐξελεγχόμενοι Aeschin. 3.10.

data.quote: τὸν θάνατόν τινος ἐπ. αὐ. μηχανωμένη
ἐπʼ αὐ. καταλαμβάνειν τινὰ ἀμαθέστερον ὄντα
ἀξιῶ σε . . ἐπʼ. αὐ. ταῦτά μοι ἐπιδεῖξαι

children.definition: very light, ὁ ἥλιος αὐ. ἐστὶ καὶ πηγὴ φωτός Herm. in Phdr. p.118A., cf. Dam. Pr. 29, Aen.Gaz. Thphr. p.52B.

data.quote: ὁ ἥλιος αὐ. ἐστὶ καὶ πηγὴ φωτός

children.definition: self-engraven or impressed, of an image in a mirror, Nonn. D. 5.599.
very grace: αὐτοχάριτες Ἀττικαί the essence of Attic graces, Alciphr. 3.43.
with the natural rim, i. e. in one piece, λήκυθοι S. Fr. 138.

with oneʼs own hand, creative, A. Supp. 592 (lyr.); αὐ. λούειν, παίειν, κτείνειν, S. Ant. 900, 1315, Aj. 57; τίνες ᾠκοδόμησαν; — ὄρνιθες αὐτόχειρες Ar. Av. 1132 sq., cf. Lys. 269, Theopomp.Com. 86, Act.Ap. 27.19, etc.: c. gen., very doer, perpetrator of a thing, αὐ. τοῦδε τοῦ τάφου S. Ant. 306; τῆς ἀσελγείας ταύτης D. 21.60; αὐ. οὔτε τῶν ἀγαθῶν οὔτε τῶν κακῶν men who accomplish neither . . , Isoc. 5.150.

children.label: II
children.definition: one who kills himself, suicide, S. Ant. 1175; αὐ. ἑαυτῶν Arist. Fr. 502; simply, murderer, S. OT 231, D. 21.116; αὐτὸν . . νομίζω αὐτόχειρά μου γεγενῆσθαι τούτοις τοῖς ἔργοις ib. 106: c. gen., αὐ. καὶ φονεῖς τῶν πολιτῶν Isoc. 4.111, cf. Men. Sam. 216; in full, τὸν αὐ. τοῦ φόνου S. OT 266, cf. El. 955, D. 18.287.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adj., murderous, esp. of murder committed by oneʼs own hand or by kinsmen, αὐ. θάνατος, σφαγή, μοῖρα, E. Ph. 880, Or. 947, Med. 1281 (lyr.); πληγέντες αὐτόχειρι σὺν μιάσματι, of brothers smitten by mutual slaughter, S. Ant. 172; φόνος Pl. R. 615c.
αὐτόχειρα γράμματα written with oneʼs own hand, autograph, D.C. 59.4.
with oneʼs own hand, Lycurg. 122, Paus. 7.16.6, Onos. 33 tit.; dub. l. in E. Or. 1040.
murder perpetrated by oneʼs own hand, Pl. Lg. 872b; διʼ αὐτοχειρίας Nic.Dam. p.46D.

children.label: II
children.definition: αὐτοχειρία, Ion. -ίη, used adverbially, = αὐτοχειρί, mostly of slaughter, αὐ. κτείνειν Hdt. 1.140; ἀπολέσαι Id. 3.74, cf. 66: generally, αὐ. διελεῖν Id. 1.123; διασπείρειν Id. 3.13, cf. Ar. Fr. 33 D.; λαβεῖν D. 25.57; καὶ αὐ. καὶ κελεύων καὶ ψήφῳ [κτείνειν] Democr. 260.
do a thing or commit a murder with oneʼs own hand, Philist. 60 ap. Poll. 2.154, where the word is called παμμίαρον.
E. Med. 1269, A.D. Pron. 70.2.
E. Or. 1040, v.l. in Hierocl. Facet. 152.
self-elected, D. 19 Arg.ii9.
αὐτοχειρί, Call. Epigr. 22: c. gen., αὐτοχερὶ ποσίων ἐδάμησαν Man. 3.200.
country and all, A. Ag. 536.

sprung from the land itself; αὐτόχθονες, οἱ, not settlers, of native stock, Hdt. 1.171, Th. 6.2, etc.: c. gen., αὐ. Ἰταλίας D.H. 1.10: esp. of the Athenians, E. Ion 29, al., Fr. 360.8, Ar. V. 1076, Isoc. 4.24, 12.124.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., indigenous, native, τὰ μὲν δύο αὐτόχθονα τῶν ἐθνέων Hdt. 4.197; αὐ. Αἰγύπτιοι PGiss. 99.5 (ii A.D.); ἀρετή Lys. 2.43; λάχανα τῶν αὐτοχθόνων Polioch. 2.6; κόσμος Philod.Scarph. 127; α. urbanitas, authentic national, i.e., Roman, manners Cic. Att. 7.2.3.

data.quote: τὰ μὲν δύο αὐτόχθονα τῶν ἐθνέων

children.definition: their own enemy, γένος ἀνθρώπων AP 7.688 ( Pall.).
self-furnished, Pl. Ax. 371d.
rudely cast, massive, of a lump of iron used as a quoit, Il. 23.826.
in very deed, Ar. Eq. 78, Luc. Dem.Enc. 13, Procop.Gaz. Ep. 58, Iamb. Myst. 5.20; dub. in S. Ichn. 38.
just, exactly, Ael. NA 2.44, Aristid. 2.228 J.

children.label: II
children.definition: straightway, Jul. Or. 6.181b.
being its own time, οὔτε ἡ ψυχὴ ἔγχρονος ἀλλʼ αὐ. Simp. in Ph. 785.2.

data.quote: οὔτε ἡ ψυχὴ ἔγχρονος ἀλλʼ αὐ.

children.definition: with its own, natural colour, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.270f.
of one and the same colour, ib. Alex. fort. 330a.
of very gold, precious, Hsch.
poured out of itself, self-flowing, θάλαμος Hes. Fr. 96.102; ὕδωρ Aristid. Or. 39(18).7, 16, cf. Sch. Pi. O. 7.12; γάλα Nonn. D. 24.131.
absorb into oneself, partake of, τοῦ ἀγνώστου Anon. in Prm. in Rh.Mus. 47.603 (dub.).

definition: αὐτοψεί or αὐτ-οψί, Adv. of αὔτοπτος,

children.definition: with oneʼs own eyes, Jul. Ep. 204, PSI 3.238.11 (vi A. D.).

seeing with oneʼs own eyes, Dsc. Praef. 5, PTeb. 286.20 (ii A. D.), Luc. Syr.D. 1; in Medic., as t.t. of the Empiric school, Gal. 1.67; ἐπὶ τῆς αὐ. SIG 827 D 4 ( Delph., ii A. D.), cf. POxy. 1272.19 (ii A. D.); ἐπὶ τὴν αὐ. ἐλθεῖν IG 9(1).61.17.

children.label: II
children.definition: supernatural manifestation, vision, Procl. in Alc. p.92 C. (pl.), Iamb. Myst. 2.4 (pl.), 7.3 (pl.); [ δαίμων] κληθεὶς εἰς αὐ. Porph. Plot. 10, cf. Dam. Isid. 13 (pl.); opp. ὄνειρος, Ps.-Callisth. 1.6; magical operation for the production of such a manifestation ( αὐθ.), PMag.Par. 1.950, PMag.Leid.W.16.38.
absolute soul, αὐ. καθαρά Herm. in Phdr. p.75 A., cf. Plot. 5.9.13, Jul. Ep. 89b (pl.).

definition: αὐτώδης, ες, Ion. for αὐθάδης, acc. to A.D. Pron. 74.9, Hsch.: but Hdt. 6.92 has αὐθαδέστεροι.

children.definition: Hsch.
one that buys for himself, Din. Fr. 89.11.
acting spontaneously, of an oracle giving a response unquestioned, Call. Fr. 264.

children.label: I
children.definition: in this very manner, even so, γυμνὸν ἐόντα αὔ. ὥς τε γυναῖκα unarmed just as I am like a woman, Il. 22.125; in the self-same way, likewise, σὺν δʼ αὔ. ἐγώ S. Ant. 85, cf. Numen. ap. Ath. 7.328d; αὔ. ὅπωσπερ . . S. Aj. 1179; αὔ., ὧδʼ αὔ., ὥς μʼ ὤλεσεν Id. Tr. 1040 (lyr.); αὔ. ὡς . . Hes. Th. 702, A.R. 1.90: c. dat., γυναιξὶν αὔ. Anacr. 21.14: hence ὡσαύτως (q. v.), in Hom. always ὡς δʼ αὔτως, as in Pl. Phd. 102e, X. An. 5.6.9.

data.quote: αὔ., ὧδʼ αὔ., ὥς μʼ ὤλεσεν

children.definition: just so, τίη σὺ κήδεαι αὔ. ἀνδρῶν; why take you no better care? v.l. for οὕτως in Il. 6.55; οἴχεται αὔ. has gone off just as he pleased, Od. 4.665: joined with words implying contempt, νήπιος αὔ. a mere child, Il. 24.726, cf. 6.400; μὰψ αὔ. 20.348; ἀνεμώλιον αὔ. 21.474; αὔ. ἄχθος ἀρούρης Od. 20.379, etc.; so, in vain, οὐκ αὔ. μυθήσομαι 14.151, cf. Il. 2.342, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: just as before, as it was, ἧσθαι, κεῖσθαι, Il. 1.133, 18.338, Od. 20.130; λευκὸν ἔτʼ αὔ. still white as when new, Il. 23.268; ἔτι κεῖται αὔ. ἐν κλισίῃσι just as he was, 24.413; καὶ αὔ. still, unceasingly, 1.520. (From αὐτός, hence αὔτως in Homer, cf. Il. 23.268, Od. 14.151 (from αὕτη with Aeol. psilosis acc. to Eust. 235.5, al.); but αὕτως is usu. written in codd. of Trag. Gramm. were divided as to etym. and accent, cf. A.D. Adv. 174.1, EM 172.34, and distd. αὕτως ‘likewise’ from αὔτως ‘in vain’. Dam. Pr. 178 uses αὕτως, = of itself (from αὑτοῦ).)

definition: αὔφην, Aeol. for αὐχήν, Jo.Gramm. Comp. 3.16.

children.definition: Supp.Epigr. 1.414 ( Gortyn, v/iv B. C.).
boastful, Xenoph. 3.5, Hsch.
bull-necked, Gloss.
cut the throat of . . , S. Aj. 298.
seize by the throat: metaph., κῆρες αὐ. ψυχήν Ph. 1.654; λόγους παλαίσμασι ib. 676:— Pass., 2.372.
bind the neck with a ligature, Hippiatr. 10.

definition: αὐχένιον, τό, Dim. of αὐχήν, An. Ox. 2.356.

children.definition: belonging to the neck, τένοντες αὐ. neck-sinews, Od. 3.450, Pancrat. Oxy. 1085.29; χαίτη Opp. C. 3.255; τρίχες Hld. 10.28.
stiff-necked, haughty, γίγαντες PMag.Par. 1.3058.

children.label: II
children.definition: tunic, Antiph. 315.
βρόχος αὐ. halter, Lyc. 1100; ligature for neck, Hippiatr. 10.

definition: αὐχέω, chiefly pres. and impf. ηὔχουν, fut. αὐχήσω E. Fr. 857, Luc. DMort. 2[22].2, AP 7.373 ( Thall.): aor. ηὔχησα ib. 6.283, 15.4, Apollod. 2.4.3: ( αὔχη):—

children.definition: boast, plume oneself, ἐπί τινι on a thing, Batr. 57, AP 6.283; τινί E. IA 412: with neut. Adj., τοσοῦτον αὐχεῖν Hdt. 7.103; μέγʼ αὐ. E. Heracl. 353 (lyr.); μηδὲν τόδʼ αὔχει Id. Andr. 463; μεγάλα Ep.Jac. 3.5: c. acc. objecti, to boast of, ἀστέρας AP 7.373 (Thall.).

children.label: II
children.definition: inf., boast or declare loudly that . . , αὐχέοντες κάλλιστα τιθέναι ἀγῶνα Hdt. 2.160; ἀπεῶσθαι Th. 2.39; σώσειν ( σῶσαι codd.) E. Andr. 311, cf. Ba. 310: c. acc. only, αὐχῶ Σεβήραν boast (that I hold her), IG 14.2001, cf. 3.172.

inf. fut., say confidently, to be proudly confident that, αὐχῶ γὰρ αὐχῶ τήνδε δωρεὰν ἐμοὶ δώσειν Δίʼ A. Pr. 340, cf. 688 (lyr.), Pers. 741, Cratin. I with a neg., οὐ γάρ ποτʼ ηὔχουν . . μεθέξειν I never thought that . . , A. Ag. 506, cf. Eu. 561 (lyr.), E. Heracl. 931.

data.quote: αὐχῶ γὰρ αὐχῶ τήνδε δωρεὰν ἐμοὶ δώσειν Δίʼ

children.label: III
children.definition: Med., αὐχήσασθαι· καυχήσασθαι, Hsch.— Never in S. ( ἐπ-, ἐξ-αυχέω, El. 65, Ant. 390); rare in Com. and Prose.
boasting, pride, κενεόφρονες αὖχαι Pi. N. 11.29; αὐχάν· καύχησιν, Hsch.
braggart, proud, Opp. H. 2.677; [ βοῦς] AP 6.114 ( Simm.).
thing boasted of, object of pride, the pride, boast, < χθονός> S. OC 710 (lyr.); cause for boasting, glory, σὺ γάρ νιν εἰς τόδʼ εἷσας αὔ. ib. 713, cf. Th. 7.75.

children.label: II
children.definition: boasting, self-confidence, Id. 2.62, 7.66; ὀπιθόμβροτον αὔ. δόξας Pi. P. 1.92: in pl., ποῦ τὰ πρόσθεν αὐ.; Pl. Ax. 365a.
boaster, Sch. Luc. Pr.Im. 10, Eust. 537.42:— Adj. αὐχημᾰτικός, ή, όν, Id. 1967.9.
neck, throat, of men and beasts, Il. 7.12, Hes. Op. 815, Arist. HA 493a5, PA 691b29: rarely, gullet, Nic. Th. 350: in pl., of one neck, S. Fr. 659.4, Orph. L. 137, AP 5.27 ( Rufin.).
τὸν αὐ. ἱστάναι to be high-spirited, Philostr. VA 7.23; αὐχένα ὑψηλὸν ἀποθέσθαι Vett.Val. 261.16.

children.label: II
children.definition: any narrow band or connexion (like a neck):
neck of land, isthmus, Hdt. 1.72, 6.37, X. An. 6.4.3.
narrow sea, strait, of the Bosporus, Hdt. 4.85, 118; αὐ. πόντου, of the Hellespont, A. Pers. 72 (lyr.); of the point at which the Danube spreads from a single stream into several branches, Hdt. 4.89.
mountain-pass, defile, Id. 7.223.
neck of the thigh-bone, Hp. Art. 55; cervix uteri, Id. Steril. 230, Poll. 2.222 (but, pars vaginalis, Gal. UP 14.3); root of the tongue, Ruf. Onom. 57.
handle of the steering-paddle in a ship, Poll. 1.90: in pl., Polyaen. 3.11.14, Hld. 5.28.
αὐχένες δρύινοι SIG 2587.308. (Cf. αὔφην; ἄμφην Theoc. 30.28.)
boasting, exultation, Th. 6.16; cf. αὐχῆτις (sic) · σεμνότης, Hsch.
boaster, blamed by Poll. 9.146.
Pi. O. 1.4. Adv. -ῶς Eust. 750.23.
Choeril. 4.4, Epigr. in POxy. 662 (Amynt.).

to be squalid or unwashed, αὐχμεῖς τε κακῶς καὶ ἀεικέα ἕσσαι Od. 24.250, cf. Ar. Nu. 442; to be parched, Pl. R. 606d; αὐχμεῖ [φυτά] dry up, Thphr. HP 4.10.7:—also αὐχμάω, part. αὐχμῶσαι interpol. in Hp. Prog. 2; αὐχμώσης Arist. Mete. 360b11; αὐχμῶντες Thphr. HP 8.10.4; αὐχμῶντα Plu. Apophth.reg. 2.187d, Luc. Vit.Auct. 7; αὐχμῶσαν Id. Apol. 6, etc.; Ep. αὐχμώοντα Nonn. D. 26.108, etc.— αὐχμέω is always used exc. in part. acc. to Phryn. PS p.10B.; αὐχμᾷς is cited from Phryn.Com. 76 by Poll. 2.34; other forms are ambiguous, αὐχμῶν Ar. Pl. 84, Anaxandr. 34.6, Thphr. Char. 26.5; αὐχμήσῃ Pl. Phdr. 251d. etc.

data.quote: αὐχμεῖς τε κακῶς καὶ ἀεικέα ἕσσαι

children.definition: Q.S. 9.372, Phryn. PS p.10B.
squalid, sordid, Pl.Com. 16D.
with squalid hair, Anaxandr. 41.9.

dry, without rain, χειμών Hp. Aph. 3.11, cf. Aër. 10; ἔτη Arist. HA 605b19; ἔαρ Id. Pr. 860a13; of places, dry, parched, τόποι Pl. Lg. 761b ( Sup.), cf. 2 Ep.Pet. 1.19; χωρία Thphr. HP 9.11.10, etc.; καρποί D.S. 2.53.

children.label: b
children.definition: parching, νόσοι Emp. 121.3.

dry, rough, squalid, οὖδας E. Alc. 947; σκληρὸς καὶ αὐ. Pl. Smp. 203d; esp. of hair (cf. foreg.), S. Fr. 475, E. Or. 387, Theoc. 25.225; βίος Luc. Salt. 1. Adv. -ρῶς, ἔχειν τοῦ προσώπου Philostr. VA 4.10.
miserable, Man. 2.169: c. gen., βιότοιο ib. 454: irreg. Sup. αὐχμότατος dub. l. in Pl.Com. 169.
squalor, metaph., Men.Rh. p.402S.
Arist. 25a30.

drought, Emp. 111.6, Hdt. 2.13, 4.198, Hp. Aph. 3.7: in pl., Th. 1.23, Isoc. 9.14, Plu. Num. 13: metaph., ὥσπερ αὐχμός τις τῆς σοφίας drought, dearth of . . , Pl. Men. 70c; so perh. αὐχμὸς τῶν σκευαρίων Ar. Pl. 839.
effects of drought, squalor, μεστὰς αὐχμοῦ τε καὶ κόνεως Pl. R. 614d.
dryness, meagreness, D.H. Dem. 44.
thirst, D.Chr. 7.152. (Perh. akin to αὖος.)

dry, τὸ αὐ. drought, Hdt. 1.142; ἔτη Arist. HA 602a13; χώρα αὐχμωδεστέρα Thphr. HP 8.1.6; arid, CP 3.10.1; squalid, κόμη E. Or. 223; σάρξ Plu. QConv. 2.688d; of colour, dull, αἱματῖτις Thphr. Lap. 37.
dirt, squalor, of the hair, [ Gal.] 16.88.
A. Pers. 871.
get a light, light a fire, ἵνα μή ποθεν ἄλλοθεν αὔοι Od. 5.490: — Med., take fire, Arat. 1035.—Only poet. (Cf. ἐναύω, etc.; from αὐσιω, cf. ONorse ausa ‘sprinkle’, Lat. haurio, haustum.)

definition: αὔω (B), fut. ἀΰσω E. Ion 1446: aor. ἤϋσα (v. infr.):—

children.definition: cry out, shout, call aloud, freq. in Hom., αὖε δʼ Ἀθήνη Il. 20.48, cf. Call. Dian. 56 sq.; κέκλετʼ ἀΰσας Il. 4.508, cf. 6.66, etc.; μακρὸν ἄϋσε 5.101; ἤϋσε . . μέγα τε δεινόν τε ὄρθια 11.10; ἤϋσεν δὲ διαπρύσιον ib. 275, etc.:—also in Trag., αὔειν λακάζειν A. Th. 186; μηδὲν μέγʼ ἀΰσῃς S. El. 830 (lyr.); δεινὸν δʼ ἀΰσας OT 1260: c. acc. cogn., utter, στεναγμὸν . . ἀΰσατʼ E. Supp. 800 (lyr.); τίνʼ αὐδὰν ἀΰσω; Id. Ion 1446.

data.quote: ἤϋσε . . μέγα τε δεινόν τε ὄρθια

children.definition: call upon, αὖε δʼ ἑταίρους Il. 11.461, 13.475, cf. Od. 9.65, Theoc. 13.58.
ring, καρφαλέον δέ οἱ ἀσπὶς . . ἄϋσεν Il. 13.409 (v. sub αὖος 2); of the sea, roar, A.R. 2.566. [In pres. and impf. αὐ- is a diphthong; in fut. and aor. a disyll. ᾰῡσω, ἤῡσα.]
ἰαύω, Nic. Th. 263, 283.

definition: αὔως, Aeol. for ἀώς, ἠώς, Sapph. Oxy. 1787.1 + 2.18, al.
ἀφάβρωμα, ατος, τό, Megarian name of a

children.definition: womanʼs garment, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.295b; cf. ἅβρωμα.

definition: ἀφαγνίζω, fut. -ιῶ LXX Le. 14.52: aor. -ήγνισα Paus. 2.31.8, LXX Le. 14.49:— Med., fut. -ιοῦμαι Hp. Morb.Sacr. 1: aor. -ηγνισάμην E. Alc. 1146:— Pass., fut. -αγνισθήσομαι LXX Nu. 19.19: aor. -ηγνίσθην ib. 19.12:—

children.definition: purify, consecrate, χθόνα E. in Gött.Nachr. 1922.9, Paus. 2.31.8; πυρκαϊὴν χρὴ ἀφαγνίσαι . . οἴνῳ Epigr.Gr. 1034.28 ( Thrace):— Med., τοῖς νερτέροις θεοῖς E. Alc. 1146, cf. Hsch., Suid.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀφαγνίσας· ἀποδύσας, συλήσας, Hsch.
purification, Sch. E. Alc. 98.
enmity, Eup. 34:—also ἀφάδιος or ἀφάδειος, = ἐχθρός, Hdn.Gr. 2.480.
displeasing, odious, EM 174.50.
mature, ripen, Thphr. CP 4.6.8.

definition: Ἀφαία, ἡ, name of divinity in Aegina, IG 4.1580; cf. Ἀφαία· ἡ Δίκτυννα, καὶ Ἄρτεμις, Hsch.
ἀφαιᾶσαι ἀπαλγῆσαι, ἀπολειτουργῆσαι, καὶ ἀπολέσαι, Hsch.

children.definition: bleeding, Archig. ap. Aët. 8.76, Hippiatr. 42.
draw blood, of leeches, Sor. 2.11; bleed, Hippiatr. 69.
that which is taken away as the choice part, LXX Ex. 35.21, Nu. 18.27 sq., al., J. AJ 14.10.12.
tribute, LXX 1 Ma. 15.5.
deduction, POxy. 1731.10 (ii A. D.).
coarse grits made from ζέα, Plin. HN 18.112.
taking away, carrying off, removal, Pl. Cri. 46c (pl.); putting off, τοῦ θνητοῦ Hierocl. in CA 27p.483M.; opp. πρόσθεσις, Plu. Lyc. 13 (pl.).
assertion of freedom of a reputed slave, Hyp. Fr. 23.
amputation, Archig. ap. Orib. 47.13.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: abstraction, ἐξ, διʼ ἀφαιρέσεως, Arist. Cael. 299a16, EN 1142a18; esp. τὰ ἐξ ἀ. mathematics, Id. APo. 81b3, Metaph. 1061a29, al.; opp. ἐκ προσθέσεως, ib. 1077b9; also τὰ ἐν ἀ. ὄντα Id. de An. 429b18, al.:—Cicero jokes on this term, Att. 6.1.2.
removal of initial letters, as in σῦς ὗς, Choerob. in Theod. 1p.148H., cf. A.D. Pron. 55.13, al.; also of medial letters, ib. 93.13; of feet in verse, opp. πρόσθεσις, POxy. 220 iii 3.
one must take away, Hp. Aph. 1.10, Pl. R. 361a; one must exclude, Id. Plt. 291c; one must take away in thought, Thphr. Metaph. 6.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀφαιρετέος, έα, έον, to be taken away, removed, Pl. R. 398e, cf. Jul. Or. 8.249d.
pick off, Ion Hist.I.
one who deprives, χρόνων Vett.Val. 55.18, cf. Ptol. Tetr. 189, Sch. Od. 13.224, Suid. s.v. ἐξαίτης.
fit for taking away, τινός A.D. Adv. 165.12; χρόνος ἐλπίδος ἀ. Vett.Val. 281.4; τὰ ἀ. τῶν βοηθημάτων evacuant remedies, prob. l. in Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.87.

children.label: II
children.definition: retrograde, of planetary motion, Ptol. Tetr. 52, etc.
one that takes away, Μοῖραι ἀ. θνητοῖσιν ἀνάγκης Orph. H. 59.18.
to be taken away, separable, Pl. Plt. 303e, Arr. Epict. 3.24.3.
deducted, PRev.Laws 55.1 (iii B. C.).

definition: ἀφαιρέω, Ion. ἀπαιρέω, fut. -ήσω: pf. ἀφῄρηκα, Ion. ἀπαραίρηκα: aor. ἀφεῖλον, later inf. ἀφέλαι GDI 4940.35 (Cret.); ἀφῄρησα Gal. 11.121:—

children.definition: take away from:—Constr.: mostly ἀ. τί τινι, σῖτον μέν σφιν ἀφεῖλε took it from him, Od. 14.455, cf. A. Eu. 360 codd., etc. (but also, relieve one of a duty, X. Cyr. 7.1.44): less freq. ἀ. τί τινος Ar. Pax 560, X. Lac. 4.7; κῆρα χώρας A. Th. 777 (lyr.); ἔκ τινος Id. Eu. 444; also τινά τι prob. l. ib. 360, S. Ph. 933, v. infr. II. I, III: c. gen., take from, τιμῆς οὔτʼ ἀφελὼν οὔτʼ ἐπορεξάμενος Sol. 5.2; μηδὲν ἀφαιρῶμεν τοῦ ἀδίκου ( from the unjust man) ἀπὸ τῆς ἀδικίας Pl. R. 360e; τοῦ πλήθους diminish the number, X. Vect. 4.4: c. acc. only, ἀπελὼν τὰ ἄχθεα having taken them off, Hdt. 1.80; βασιλέων . . ὀργὰς ἀφῄρουν took away, E. Med. 455, cf. Ar. Pl. 22, Ra. 518.
set aside, κρέα SIG 1044.41 ( Halic., iv B. C.).

children.label: b
children.definition: exclude, separate, τὸ Ἑλληνικὸν ὡς ἓν ἀπὸ πάντων ἀφαιροῦντες χωρίς Pl. Plt. 262d; opp. προστιθέναι, Id. Phd. 95e, etc.

data.quote: τὸ Ἑλληνικὸν ὡς ἓν ἀπὸ πάντων ἀφαιροῦντες χωρίς

children.definition: ἀ. ἀπὸ . . subtract from, Euc. Ax. 3 ( Pass.), etc.; of ratios, divide out from both sides of an equation, Apollon. Perg. 1.41 ( Pass.); intercept, in Pass., Procl. Hyp. 2.27.
abstract, c. acc., Arist. APo. 74a37, al.: abs., Id. Metaph. 1030a33.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., fut. ἀφαιρήσομαι (in pass. sense, v.l. for ἀπαιρε-θήσεσθαι, Hdt. 5.35, cf. Antipho Fr. 57), later ἀφελοῦμαι Timostr. 5, Plb. 3.29.7: aor. ἀφειλόμην, later ἀφειλάμην Ph. 2.586, D.C. 41.63, cf. Phryn. 116: pf. ἀφῄρημαι (in med. sense) X. Cyr. 7.5.79 (spelt ἀφείρ- Sammelb. 4309 (iii B. C.)):—from Hom. downwds. more freq. than Act., take away for oneself; also in reciprocal sense, ἀφαιρεῖσθον τύχην ye have received each the fortune of the other, E. El. 928:—Constr. like Act., ἀφαιρεῖσθαί τί τινι, as καὶ δή μοι γέρας . . ἀφαιρήσεσθαι ἀπειλεῖς Il. 1.161; τί τινος 5.673, 691, 9.335, Th. 3.58, Lys. 24.13, etc. (also τεύχεα . . ὤμοιϊν ἀφελέσθαι Il. 13.510); τι πρός τινος E. Tr. 1034; τι ἀπό τινος Ar. V. 883; ἔκ τινος X. Cyn. 12.9: c. dupl. acc. rei et pers., bereave or deprive of, μήτε σὺ τόνδʼ . . ἀποαίρεο κούρην Il. 1.275, cf. Hdt. 1.71, 7.104; freq. in Att. and Trag., Lys. l.c., Th. 8.74, D. 20.46, etc.; τέκνα ἀ. τινά E. Andr. 613, cf. Ar. Ach. 464: rarely c. acc. pers. et gen. rei, ἀ. τὰς κύνας τοῦ εὑρεῖν X. Cyn. 6.4; τῆς ἀρχῆς τινά Plu. Ant. 60; τὴν Ἀμαζόνα τοῦ ζωστῆρος Paus. 5.10.9.

data.quote: καὶ δή μοι γέρας . . ἀφαιρήσεσθαι ἀπειλεῖς

children.definition: ἀ. ψήφισμα cancel or rescind, And. 2.24; ἀφελομένης τῆς νυκτὸς τὸ ἔργον having broken off the action, Th. 4.134; ἕως κελαινῆς νυκτὸς ὄμμʼ ἀφείλετο A. Pers. 428: abs., μέχρι σκότος ἀφείλετο (sc. τὴν δίωξιν) X. HG 1.2.16; ἀ. τὴν μνήμην πολλῶν ἀγαθῶν D. 22.13.

μή c. inf., prevent, hinder from doing, τί μʼ ἄνδρα . . ἀφείλου μὴ κτανεῖν; S. Ph. 1303, cf. E. Tr. 1146; κἄκτεινας, ἤ τις συμφορά σʼ ἀφείλετο [μὴ κτεῖναι]; Id. Andr. 913; c. inf. Pass., τὸν τὰ ὕστερον ἀφείλετο ἀδικήματα εὐεργέτην μὴ ὀνομασθῆναι Paus. 8.52.2; c. inf. only, Pi. I. 1.62: simply, obstruct, ἀρχήν Pl. Lg. 958c.

data.quote: τί μʼ ἄνδρα . . ἀφείλου μὴ κτανεῖν;
τὸν τὰ ὕστερον ἀφείλετο ἀδικήματα εὐεργέτην μὴ ὀνομασθῆναι

children.definition: ἀ. τινὰ εἰς ἐλευθερίαν, Lat. vindicare in libertatem, claim as free, Pl. Lg. 914e, Isoc. 12.97, D. 58.19, cf. Lys. 23.10, Aeschin. 1.62.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., fut. -αιρεθήσομαι E. Hel. 938; -ήσομαι Antipho Fr. 57: pf. ἀφῄρημαι, Ion. ἀπαραίρημαι Hdt. 7.159, etc.:— to be robbed or deprived of a thing, τι A. Ch. 962 (lyr.), Hdt. 3.137, etc.; τι πρός or ὑπό τινος, Id. 1.70, 3.65, 7.159; ἀφῃρέθην τὰ ἐνέχυρα ὑπό τινος D. 47.41; ἐκ χερῶν ἀφῃρέθην had them taken out of my hands, E. Tr. 486: c. inf., ἀφῃρέθη Σκίρωνος ἀκτὰς ὄμμα τοὐμὸν εἰσορᾶν was deprived of, hindered from seeing them, Id. Hipp. 1207: less freq. μηδὲν τοῦ ἐμοῦ ὄγκου ἀφαιρεθέντος ἀλλὰ σοῦ αὐξηθέντος Pl. Tht. 155b.

data.quote: μηδὲν τοῦ ἐμοῦ ὄγκου ἀφαιρεθέντος ἀλλὰ σοῦ αὐξηθέντος

children.definition: ὁ ἀφαιρεθείς, in Law, the person from whom a slave has been claimed, Id. Lg. 915a.
abstractly, interpol. in Phlp. in APo. 242.24.
tare, Vicia angustifolia, Pherecr. 188, Arist. HA 596a25, Thphr. HP 8.8.3, Dsc. 2.148, etc.

definition: ἀφάλλομαι, aor. inf. ἀφάλασθια Ael. VH 6.14; Ep. aor. part. ἀπάλμενος Bion Fr. 10.15:—

children.definition: spring off or down from, πήδημα κοῦφον ἐκ νεὼς ἀφήλατο A. Pers. 305; ἐπὶ τὴν κεφαλὴν . . ἀφήλατο jumped off on to his head, Ar. Nu. 147; ἀφαλόμενος τοῦ ἵππου Plu. Caes. 27, cf. Ael. l.c.; of a river, τῆς πέτρας πλεῖον ἢ στάδιον ἀ. τὴν καταφοράν Plb. 10.48.5.

data.quote: τῆς πέτρας πλεῖον ἢ στάδιον ἀ. τὴν καταφοράν

children.definition: jump, bound, of a quick pulse, Ruf. Syn.Puls. 7.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: rebound, glance off, ἀπὸ τῶν λείων Arist. de An. 420a22; πέτρου Nic. Th. 906: abs., AP 9.159; to be reflected, πῦρ ἀπὸ πυρός Plu. Fac.lun. 2.931b.
springing off, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.31 tit.
jumping exercise, Aret. CD 1.3, Philum. ap. Orib. 45.29.37, Antyll. ib. 6.31.1.
springing off or back, Hsch.
without φάλος, κυνέη Il. 10.258, BGU 1190.3 ( i B. C.?).

definition: ἀφαμαρτάνω, aor. part. ἀφαμαρτήσαντος Orph. A. 643; Ep. aor. ἀπήμβροτεν Il. 15.521, 16.466, 477, Pancrat. Oxy. 1085.7:—

children.definition: miss oneʼs mark, c. gen., καὶ τοῦ μέν ῥʼ ἀφάμαρτεν Il. 8.119, etc.; θηρός Pancrat. l.c.: also in Prose, X. HG 6.1.15, D. 14.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: lose, be deprived of what one has, σεῦ ἀφαμαρτούσῃ Il. 6.411; φίλου ἀπὸ πατρὸς ἁμαρτών 22.505.
talking at random, Il. 3.215.

definition: Ἀφάμιος, ὁ (sc. μήν), name of month at Thronium, Klio 16.170; at Ambryssus, GDI 2256.5.

children.definition: serfs in Crete, like the Helots in Laconia, Str. 15.1.34, Ath. 6.263f (written Ἀμφ-); cf. ἀφημοῦντας, ἀφημιάστους.
fasten off, Antyll. ap. Orib. 45.24.4:—hence ἀφαμμᾰτ-ιστέον, Sor. 1.56.
Suid. s.h.v.

definition: ἀφανδάνω, Ion. aor. inf. ἀπαδεῖν Hdt. 2.129:—

children.definition: displease, not to please, εἰ δʼ ὑμῖν ὅδε μῦθος ἀφανδάνει Od. 16.387; σοὶ τἄμʼ ἀφανδάνοντʼ ἔφυ S. Ant. 501.

data.quote: εἰ δʼ ὑμῖν ὅδε μῦθος ἀφανδάνει

children.definition: invisibly, obscurely, Hdn. Epim. 255.
obscurity, uncertainty, τύχας Pi. I. 4(3).49: metaph., ἀξιώματος ἀ. want of illustrious birth or rank, Th. 2.37.
invisibility, Dam. Pr. 6.

children.label: II
children.definition: disappearance, destruction, A. Ag. 384 (lyr.), Procl. in Prm. p.840S.—The form ἀφανία is mentioned by A.D. Synt. 341.8.
fail to put in an appearance, dub. in PTeb. 43.22 (ii B. C.):— but ἀφᾱνέω, thrash, beat, Ar. Eq. 394; cf. ἄφηνα· ἔκοψα, and ἀφῆναι· τὸ τὰς ἐπτισμένας κριθὰς ταῖς χερσὶ τρῖψαι, Hsch.; v. αἵνω.

unseen, esp. of the nether world, Ταρτάρου πυθμήν Pi. Fr. 207, cf. A. Th. 860 (lyr.); ἀ. κἀν Ἀΐδα δόμῳ φοιτάσῃς Sapph. 68; χάσμα ἀ. a blind pit, Hdt. 6.76; ἡ ἀ. θεός, of Persephone, S. OC 1556 (lyr.); ὁ ἀ. πόλος, i. e. the south pole, Arist. Cael. 285b21, Mu. 394b31 (but ἀ. κόσμος starless, Vett.Val. 6.22).

ἀ. γίγνεσθαι, = ἀφανίζεσθαι, disappear, ὑπὸ γῆν Hdt. 3.104, cf. E. IT 757, Pl. R. 360a; so ἀ. ἦν disappeared, Hdt. 7.37, cf. X. An. 1.4.7; of soldiers missing after a battle, Th. 2.34; runaway, absconded, PGen. 5.4 (ii A. D.).

children.label: b
children.definition: στήλας ἀ. ποιῆσαι obliterate, SIG 38.38 ( Teos).

unnoticed, secret, ἀ. νόος ἀθανάτων Sol. 17; ἀ. νεῦμα a secret sign, Th. 1.134; ἀ. χωρίον out of sight, Id. 4.29, cf. ib. 67; ἀ. ξιφίδιον concealed, Id. 8.69; διʼ ἐπιστολῶν ἀφανῶν secret or invisible writings, Ph. Bel. 102.29: c. part., ἀ. εἶναι ἀπιόντες depart without being noticed, X. An. 4.2.4; ἀ. ὄντες ἠδίκουν Th. 1.68; μαντικῇ χρώμενος οὐκ ἀ. ἦν he was well known to do . . , X. Mem. 1.1.2.

children.label: b
children.definition: uncertain, doubtful, ἀ. νοῦσοι Hdt. 2.84; σὺν ἀφανεῖ λόγῳ on an uncertain charge, S. OT 657 (lyr.); ἐν ἀφανεῖ λ. Antipho 5.59; μόρος S. OC 1682 (lyr.); ὄνομα E. Tr. 1322 (lyr.); ἐλπίς Th. 5.103; πρόφασις ἀφανεστάτη λόγῳ Id. 1.23; οὐκ ἀ. τεκμήρια X. Ages. 6.1; μεθέντας τἀφανῆ, opp. τὸ πρὸς ποσί, S. OT 131; ἀ. χάρις a favour from an unknown hand, D. 19.240; ἐς ἀφανὲς τὸν μῦθον ἀνενείκας Hdt. 2.23; μισῶ μὲν ὅστις τἀφανῆ περισκοπῶν S. Fr. 737; τὰ ἀ. μεριμνᾶν Ar. Fr. 672; ὑπὲρ τῶν ἀ. φανεροῖς μαρτυρίοις χρῆσθαι Arist. EN 1104a13; of what is beyond the evidence of sense, opp. φανερόν, ἁρμονίη ἀ. φανερῆς κρείττων Heraclit. 54, cf. Phld. Sign. 1, al.; τἀφανὲς διὰ τοῦ φαινομένου συλλογίζεσθαι Epicur. Nat. 14.4; τὸ τῆς τύχης ἀ. οἷ προβήσεται E. Alc. 785; τὸ ἀ. τοῦ κατορθώσειν Th. 2.42; ἐν ἀφανεῖ ἔτι κεῖσθαι, ἐν τῷ ἀ. εἶναι, Id. 1.42, 3.23; ἐν ἀ. κεκτῆσθαί τι secretly, Pl. Lg. 954e; ἐκ τοῦ ἀφανοῦς Th. 1.51, 4.96, etc.; ἐξ ἀ. A. Fr. 57.9, Ar. Ra. 1332: neut. pl. as Adv., E. Hipp. 1289 (lyr.). Regul. Adv. ἀφανῶς Th. 3.43, etc.: Sup. -έστατα X. HG 5.1.27.

data.quote: ὑπὲρ τῶν ἀ. φανεροῖς μαρτυρίοις χρῆσθαι
τὸ τῆς τύχης ἀ. οἷ προβήσεται

children.definition: unnoticed, obscure, E. Tr. 1244; also οὐ γὰρ ἀ. κρινεῖτε τὴν δίκην Th. 3.57; ἀ. καὶ ταπεινὴ φύσις D. 61.35.

data.quote: οὐ γὰρ ἀ. κρινεῖτε τὴν δίκην

children.definition: ἀ. οὐσία personal property, as money, which can be secreted and made away with (cf. ἀφανίζω I.7), opp. φανερά ( real), as land, Lys. 32.4, cf. BCH 27.219 ( Crete); opp. ἐμφανής, IG 12(2).15.8 (Mytil.), SIG 554.17; but simply, concealed, ἀφανῆ καταστῆσαι τὴν οὐσίαν Lys. 20.23: in lit. sense, ἀ. πλοῦτος Ar. Ec. 602; πλοῦτος ἀ. ὃν σὺ κατορύξας ἔχεις Men. 128.16.

data.quote: πλοῦτος ἀ. ὃν σὺ κατορύξας ἔχεις

definition: ἀφανίζω, Att. fut. -ῐῶ X. An. 3.2.11, Pl. Tht. 184a: pf. ἠφάνικα D. 36.18:—

children.definition: make unseen, hide, νεφέλη . . ἠφάνισεν ἥλιον X. An. 3.4.8; hush up, ἔργον Pl. Smp. 217e: hence, lose sight of, Eub. 107.18; ἀ. τὸ συμφορώτατον do away with, reject, Hp. VM 21 (v.l. for ἀφαιρέοντας); make away with a person, Hdt. 3.126, X. Mem. 1.2.53, Th. 4.80; μή μʼ ἀφανίσῃ λαβών Men. Epit. 210:— Pass., τὴν γνώμην μηδὲν . . ἀφανισθεῖσαν in no part concealed or suppressed, Th. 7.8.
do away with, remove, ἄχος S. OC 1712 (lyr.); τινὰ πόλεος carry one off from the city, E. Ph. 1041 (lyr.); Μούσας ἀ. Ar. Nu. 972; ἀ. αὑτὸν εἰς τὸν νεών disappear into the temple, Id. Pl. 741.
destroy, Ἀθήνας X. An. 3.2.11, cf. Plb. 1.81.6, LXX De. 7.2; ὅλως ἀ. ἱερά D. 21.147, cf. Epigr.Gr. 376.8 ( Aezani).
obliterate writing, Th. 6.54; footsteps, X. Cyn. 5.3, etc.; traces of bloodshed, Antipho 5.45; spirit away a witness, ib. 52; get rid of, δίκην Ar. Nu. 760.
secrete, steal, X. Oec. 14.2.

obscure, mar oneʼs good name, etc., πατρικὰς ἀρετάς, ἀξίωσιν, δόξαν, Th. 7.69, 2.61: in good sense, ἀ. ἀγαθῷ κακόν wipe out ill deeds by good, ib. 42; δύσκλειαν Id. 3.58; τὰ χρώματα ἀ. ἐκ τοῦ σώματος, of the wasting effect of grief, Antiph. 98; τρίχα βαφῇ ἀ. disguise it by dyeing, Ael. VH 7.20; ἀ. τὰ πρόσωπα (cf. ἀπρόσωπος), of artificial disfigurement, Ev.Matt. 6.16, cf. LXX Jl. 2.20, Za. 7.14.

children.label: b
children.definition: spoil, οἶνον, ὕδωρ, Sor. 1.90, Gal. 9.645.
make away with property, etc., ἀργύριον, ναυτικόν, ἀνθρώπους, Aeschin. 1.101, 3.222, D. 28.12; ἀ. τὴν οὐσίαν Aeschin. 1.103; but, conceal the existence of, ἐργαστήριον, οὐσίαν, D. 27.26,44.
drain a cup of wine, Eub. 82.
ἀφανίσαι· σκεπάσαι, προνομεῦσαι, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., disappear, be missing, Hdt. 4.8, 124, S. Ant. 255; of persons buried by a sand-storm, Hdt. 3.26; or lost at sea, Th. 8.38, X. HG 1.6.33; ἀ. κατὰ τῆς θαλάσσης, of islands, Hdt. 7.6; ὑποβρύχιος ἠφ. Plu. Crass. 19; ἀ. ἐκ τῶν Θρηίκων Hdt. 4.95; ἐξ ἀνθρώπων Lys. 2.11; ἀ. εἰς ὕλην disappear into it, X. Cyn. 10.23; καταγελασθὲν ἠφανίσθη was laughed down and disappeared, Th. 3.83.
live retired, X. Ages. 9.1.
getting rid of, τῆς δίκης Ar. Nu. 765; τῶν συνθηκῶν D. 33.22; destruction, λόγων Pl. Sph. 259e.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass.) disappearance, Hdt. 4.15, Arist. Pr. 953a17, Epicur. Ep. 2p.52U.
extermination, destruction, Plb. 5.11.5; πόλεων D.S. 15.48; σώματος καὶ ψυχῆς Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.107d; ἀφανισμῷ ἀφανίζειν LXX De. 7.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: = foreg. II, Arist. HA 580b21, Luc. Alex. 19; ἄστρων Thphr. Sign. 2 (pl.), cf. Cleom. 2.5; occultation, Theo Sm. p.137 H.; Περὶ ἀ. ἡλιακῶν, title of work by Eudoxus, on occultations of stars by the sun, Phld. D. 1.21; τῆς σελήνης Plu. QConv. 2.670c; ἐγγὺς ἀφανισμοῦ Ep.Hebr. 8.13.
to be suppressed, [ λόγος] Isoc. 12.233.

destroyer, dub. l. in Plu. Vit. aer. al. 2.828f, cf. Sch. A. Th. 175, etc.; scavenger, PLond. 2.387.9 (iii A. D.):—fem. ἀφᾰν-ίστρια, Sch. Opp. H. 2.487:—hence ἀφᾰν-ιστικός, ή, όν, causing to disappear, τινός A.D. Pron. 33.15; τριχῶν Archig. ap. Aët. 6.63, cf. Crito ap. Gal. 12.447; destroying, Sch. A. Th. 145. Adv. -κῶς Sch. Il. 21.220, al.
λίθος PMag.Par. 2.195.
not manifested, Corp.Herm. 5.1, Olymp. in Phd. p.35N. Adv. -τως Ascl. in Metaph. 151.6, Olymp. in Phd. p.38 N.
unable to imagine a thing, Plu. Sollert. 2.960d, Cat. Cod.Astr. 7.215.7.
without φαντασία, φύσις Stoic. 2.304, al.: c. gen., ψυχὴ ἀ. τοῦ ὄντος Ph. 1.230. Adv. -τως, κινεῖσθαι, opp. ὁρμῇ καὶ φαντασίᾳ χρῆσθαι, Id. 1.641, cf. Porph. Gaur. 7.3.
without dreams, Gal. 16.221,525.

children.label: II
children.definition: not sensibly presented, εἶδος, of pure form, Syrian. in Metaph. 92.5.
derelict lands, Cod.Theod. 13.11.3, prob. in Lyd. Mag. 3.70; cf. afanticius Cod. Theod. 5.11.9.

made invisible, blotted out, ἀκήδεστοι καὶ ἄ. Il. 6.60; ἄσπερμος γενεὴ καὶ ἄ. ὄληται 20.303, etc.; hidden, ἄ. ἕρμα A. Ag. 1007 (lyr.); ἔφηνʼ ἄφαντον φῶς S. Ph. 297; ἄ. ἔπελες Pi. O. 1.46; ἐκ βροτῶν ἄ. βῆναι S. OT 832; ἁνὴρ ἄ. ἐκ . . στρατοῦ he has disappeared, A. Ag. 624; ἄ. οἴχεσθαι ib. 657, Jul. Or. 2.59a; ἔρρειν S. OT 560; ἀρθεῖσʼ ἄ. E. Hel. 606; ἐκ χερῶν Id. Hipp. 827 (lyr.); ἴχνος πλατᾶν ἄ. disappearing, A. Ag. 695 (lyr.); invisible, νύξ Parm. 9.3.
in secret, ἄφαντα βρέμειν Pi. P. 11.30.
obscure, Id. N. 8.34; θεοῖς δῆλος θνητοῖσι δʼ ἄ. Epimenid.II.—Poet. and late Prose, ἄ. γενέσθαι D.S. 3.60, 4.65, Ev.Luc. 24.31; τὰ ἄφαντα φήναντες Aristid. 1.260 J., cf. Sch. Arat. 899.
make ἄφαντος, hide, Eust. 882.45:— Pass., disappear, Sch. Arat. 899; evaporate, Syn.Alch. p.67 B.; to be sublimated, Zos. Alch. p.163 B.
once for all, PFlor. 158.10 (iii A. D.).
one must fasten, Antyll. ap. Orib. 45.24.10.

definition: ἀφάπτω, aor. ἀφῆψα, imper. ἄφαψον Ph. Bel. 65.37:—

children.definition: fasten from or upon, ἅμματα ἀπάψας having tied knots on a string, Hdt. 4.98, cf. Hp. Fist. 4:— Med., LXX Pr. 3.3, al.:— Pass., to be hung on, hang on, pf. part. ἀπαμμένος ( Ion. for ἀφημμ-) Hdt. 2.121.δʹ; ἀφημμένος ἐκ ποδεώνων Theoc. 22.52.
straightway, forthwith, in Hom. mostly at the beginning of a clause, with δέ following, ἄ. δʼ ἤμυσε καρήατι Il. 19.405, cf. Od. 2.95: without δέ, thereupon, after that, Il. 11.418.

suddenly, quickly, ἄ. κεραοὶ τελέθουσι Od. 4.85: strengthd., ἄ. αὐτίκα Il. 23.593; πέμπε δράκοντας ἄ. Pi. N. 1.40, cf. 10.63, Pae. 6.81, Emp. 35.6, 110.8.—Rare in Trag., A. Pers. 469; ἄ. βέβακε S. Tr. 133, 529, cf. E. IT 1274 (lyr. exc. in A. l.c.): also in later Ep. as A.R. 2.539, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Thgn. 716 as if Adj., swift, fleet (cf. ἀφάρτερος) , παῖδες Βορέω τῶν ἄφαρ εἰσὶ πόδες.
EM 175.24, Hsch., Suid.
belly-fin of female tunny, dub. in Arist. HA 543a13.
without φᾶρος, unclad, naked, of the Χάριτες, Euph. 87; cf. ἄφᾱρος.
hybrid arbutus, Arbutus hybrida, Thphr. HP 1.9.3, 3.3.1.
without medicine, not physicked, Hp. Acut. (Sp.) 27; without cosmetics, ξανθίζειν ἀφαρμάκευτα Alciphr. Fr. 5.4.
without medicinal properties, Gal. 6.650.

children.label: II
children.definition: without bloom, χρῶμα Eust. 1416.2, Hsch.
unanointed, Nic. Th. 115; unpoisoned, κύλιξ ἀ. Luc. DMort. 17[7].2.
not to suit, Oenom. ap. Eus. PE 5.24.
improvised, ‘hasty’ broth, Eust. 1191.13.
Call. Fr. 183.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄφᾱρος, ον, = ἀφαρής, Hsch.
abreptio, Gloss.

definition: ἀφαρπάζω, fut. Ep. -άξω, Att. -άσομαι:— Pass., pf. -ήρπασμαι X. Cyn. 9.18: aor. 1 -ηρπάσθην Id. HG 5.4.17; -ηρπάγην IPE 1.26 ( Olbia): —

children.definition: tear off or from, Ἕκτωρ δʼ ὡρμήθη κόρυθα . . κρατὸς ἀφαρπάξαι Il. 13.189; snatch away, steal from, τί τινος Ar. Eq. 1062: c. acc. only, snatch eagerly, S. Tr. 548, E. Ion 1178; ἀ. τὸν στέφανον D. 21.64; of death, IG 12(7).52.9 ( Amorgos):— Pass., Lys. 19.31; φωτὸς ἀφαρπασθείς, of one dead, IG 14.1386, cf. 12(7).400 ( Amorgos).

data.quote: Ἕκτωρ δʼ ὡρμήθη κόρυθα . . κρατὸς ἀφαρπάξαι

definition: ἀφάρτερος [ ᾰφ], α, ον, Comp. Adj. (from ἄφαρ)

children.definition: more fleet, τῶν δʼ ἵπποι μὲν ἔασιν ἀφάρτεροι Il. 23.311; cf. Dionys.Epic. ap. St.Byz. s.v. Κάσπειρος.

data.quote: τῶν δʼ ἵπποι μὲν ἔασιν ἀφάρτεροι

children.definition: unploughed, untilled, Call. Fr. 82c.

speechlessness, caused by fear or perplexity, ἔκπληξιν ἡμῖν ἀφασίαν τε προστιθεῖς E. Hel. 549; ἀ. μʼ ἔχει Id. IA 837, cf. Ar. Th. 904; ἀ. ἡμᾶς λαμβάνει τί ποτε χρὴ λέγειν Pl. Lg. 636e; εἰς ἀ. τινὰ ἐμβάλλειν Id. Phlb. 21d; εἰς ἀ. ἐμβάλλειν πράγματος inability to say anything about it, S.E. P. 2.211, cf. Dam. Pr. 7.

data.quote: ἀ. ἡμᾶς λαμβάνει τί ποτε χρὴ λέγειν

definition: ἀφάσσω, Ion., Ep., and late Prose,

children.definition: feel, Hp. Nat.Mul. 11, etc.; ἄφασον αὐτοῦ τὰ ὦτα Hdt. 3.69, cf. A.R. 2.710, 4.428, v.l. in Call. Fr. 317, cf. Musae. 82, etc.; ὥσπερ ἐν σκότει ἀφάσσων groping, Dam. Pr. 42, cf. Iamb. Myst. 3.6, etc.:— Med., A.R. 4.181:— Pass., Hp. Morb. 2.30 and 41.
not uttered or named, nameless, ἄνδρες ὁμῶς ἄ. τε φατοί τε Hes. Op. 3.

data.quote: ἄνδρες ὁμῶς ἄ. τε φατοί τε

children.definition: unutterable, ineffable, λόγος E. Ion 782 (lyr.); ἄ. μέλεα monstrous, Pi. N. 1.47; κεφαλαί AP 6.112 ( Pers.); ἄ. χρήματα untold sums, Hdt. 7.190; ἄ. νέφος, κτύπος, S. OT 1314 (lyr.), OC 1464 (lyr.); ὀρνιθαρίων ἄφατον (Schw. for -των) πλῆθος Anaxandr. 41.63; πώλων ἄφατον τάχος IG 14.2012.4 (Sulp. Max.); ἡδονή Phld. D. 3.14; ὑπερβολὴ δυνάμεως Hermog. Inv. 1.4; δύναμις Plot. 4.8.6; ἄφατον ὡς . . thereʼs no saying how . . , i.e. marvellously, immensely, Ar. Av. 428, Lys. 198. Adv. -τως Dsc. 1.13.

definition: ἀφαυαίνω, aor. part. -ηνας Lyc. ap. Orib. 8.25.8, PHolm. 12.12, but inf. -ᾶναι Plot. 4.4.32:—

children.definition: starve, wither, Thphr. HP 3.18.9:— Pass., ib. 4.2.11; to be parched, δίψῃ ἀφαυανθήσομαι Ar. Ec. 146, cf. Arist. Pr. 896a14, Lyc. ap. Orib. 8.25.17; ἵνα μὴ ζητῶν τὸν σύαγρον ἀφαυανθῇς Ath. 9.401e.

data.quote: ἵνα μὴ ζητῶν τὸν σύαγρον ἀφαυανθῇς

children.definition: grill, roast, Hld. 2.19 (prob.), Porph. Abst. 4.20. (Cf. ἀπαυαίνω.)

feeble, powerless, ἠΰτε παιδὸς ἀφαυροῦ Il. 7.235, cf. Nic. Th. 198; dim, Arat. 256; almost always Comp. and Sup., σέο πολλὸν ἀφαυρότερος Il. 7.457; ἵνα μή οἱ ἀφαυρότερον βέλος εἴη 12.458; οὔ μιν ἀφαυρότατος βάλʼ Ἀχαιῶν 15.11, cf. Od. 20.110, Hes. Op. 586, Pi. P. 4.272 ( Comp.), Theoc. 21.49 ( Comp.); ἀνδρὸς γηρέντος πολλὸν -ότερος Xenoph. 9, etc.; ῥείθρων ἀφαυροτέρην, of a bridge, too weak to resist the stream, Epigr.Gr. 1078.6 ( Adana): so in Prose, σιτία -ότερα less nutritious, Hp. Mul. 1.67; [ κενεὼν] -ότατόν ἐστι X. Eq. 12.8; Posit., Democr. 285, Ti.Locr. 102c, Arist. EN 1101b2, Hymn.Is. 122. Adv. -ρῶς AP 6.267 ( Diotim.): Comp. -ότερον, τροχάει Arat. 227.

data.quote: ἵνα μή οἱ ἀφαυρότερον βέλος εἴη

children.definition: feebleness, τῶν αἰσθήσεων Anaxag. 21.
make weak, Erot. s.v. ἀμαλδύνεται (v.l. ἀμαυροῦται).
dry up, parch, v.l. for ἀφᾱνέω in Ar. Eq. 394.

definition: ἄφαψις, ἡ, dub. sens. in Gal. 19.368.

children.definition: to handle, θώρηκα καὶ ἀγκύλα τόξʼ ἁφόωντα rubbing and polishing them, Il. 6.322; ὠτειλὰς ἁφόωσιν Opp. H. 5.329; ἁφόων θησαυρόν AP 11.366 ( Maced.).
want of light, Max.Tyr. 40.4.

without light, φῶς ἀ. a light that is no light (i. e. to the blind), S. OC 1549; νυκτὸς ἀφεγγὲς βλέφαρον, of the moon, E. Ph. 543; simply, dark, σπῆλυγξ Opp. C. 3.324; ὀμίχλη AP 9.675; δηϊοτής a night battle, Nonn. D. 24.165; Ἀΐδα . . τὸν ἀφεγγέα χῶρον Epigr.Gr. 372.13 ( Cotiaeum), cf. D.H. 8.52.
not visible to the eye, ὀδμά A. Pr. 115.
εἴ τι . . τυγχάνεις ἀφεγγὲς φέρων something ill-starred, unlucky, S. OC 1481 (lyr.).
obscure, ἔκδοσις Olymp.Alch. p.70B.

definition: ἀφέδιτος (prob. ἀφείδ-, cf. φειδίτια) ἡμέρα day

children.definition: when no sacrifice is offered, at Sparta, Hsch. (leg. <οὐ> θύουσιν).
menstruation, Dam. ap. Suid. s.v. διαγνώμων.
Hsch.
Boeotian magistracy, IG 7.3207 (Orchom. Boeot.), al.
menses muliebres, LXX Le. 15.19, al., Dsc. 2.75, Gal. 14.208.

children.label: II
children.definition: Εἰλειθυίας ἄ. exudation from silver fir, Thphr. HP 5.9.8.
privy, OGI 483.220 (Pergam.), Ev.Matt. 15.17.
to be unsparing, lavish of, ψυχῆς S. El. 980; τοῦ βίου Th. 2.43; σφῶν αὐτῶν ib. 51; τῶν σωμάτων Lys. 2.25: abs., ἀφειδήσαντες [πόνου, or the like] ungrudgingly, Hp. Art. 37; recklessly, E. IT 1354.

children.label: II
children.definition: take no care for, neglect, εἴ τις τοῦδʼ ἀφειδήσοι πόνου S. Ant. 414 (s. v. l.); reck not of, μαινομένης θαλάσσης Musae. 303; βασιλῆος, ἀέθλων, τοκήων A.R. 2.98 ( ἀκήδησαν Choerob.), 869, 3.630; Ἀφροδίτης Nonn. D. 8.217: also in Prose, Str. 1.2.6.
not sparing of, νεῶν καὶ πεισμάτων A. Ag. 195 (lyr.); ἀ. δείματος lightly regarding it, A.R. 4.1252; ἀ. πρὸς τὸν ἔρωτα Call. Epigr. 47.7: Sup. -έστατοι, τῶν ἀγαθῶν D.Chr. 1.24.
ἀ. ὁ κατάπλους καθεστήκει the landing was made without regard to cost or risk, Th. 4.26; not spared, lavishly bestowed, χρυσός Call. Cer. 128; δῶρα AP 11.59 ( Maced.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -δῶς, Aeol. and Ion. -δέως Alc. 34, Hdt. 1.163, al., Ep. -δείως A.R. 3.897:— freely, lavishly, Alc. l.c.; διδόναι Hdt. l.c., D. 18.88; ἀ. ἀπιέναι τὰ τοξεύματα Hdt. 9.61: Comp. -έστερον, ταῖς λέξεσι χρῆσθαι Hermog. Id. 2.11; unsparingly, ὁρμῆσαι πρὸς τὸν πόλεμον D. 11.2.

without mercy, κατακόψαι Hdt. 1.207; φονεύειν Id. 9.39; χρώμενον Democr. 159; κολαζόντων ἀφειδέστερον ἢ ὡς δεσπόται, -έστατα τιμωρεῖν, X. Cyr. 4.2.47, An. 1.9.13; ἀ. ἔχειν ἑαυτῶν Arist. Pol. 1315a29, cf. Paus. 4.4.8.
generosity, liberality, Pl. Def. 412c, Plu. Amat. 2.762d.
unsparing treatment, σώματος Ep.Col. 2.23.
pf. part. Pass. ἀφειργμένη Ael. NA 12.21.
far away, Nic. Th. 674.
one must abstain from, τινός X. Mem. 1.2.34; τροφῆς Porph. Abst. 1.38, etc.; one must leave alone, τινός Gal. 17(2).359: so in pl. ἀφεκ-τέα, Ar. Lys. 124; cf. ἀποσχετέον.
abstemious, Arr. Epict. 2.22.20; τὸ ἀ. Porph. Abst. 3.26: c. gen., ib. 3.1.
simplicity, Hp. Decent. 3, Antiph. 163.8; περὶ τὴν δίαιταν Plb. 6.48.3; of style, Ath. 15.693f, Hermog. Id. 1.1, al.; opp. σφοδρότης, ib.II; of terminology, Gal. 10.269.
without a stone, even, smooth, διὰ τῶν ἀφελῶν πεδίων Ar. Eq. 527.

children.label: II
children.definition: artless, simple, of persons, S. Fr. 723, D. Ep. 4.11, Luc. DDeor. 10[4].3; εὔκολος καὶ ἀ. Plu. Cat.Ma. 6; ἀφελέστατοι τῶν πρότερον Phylarch. 43; frater ἀφελέστατος Cic. Att. 1.18.1; ἀ. κατὰ τὴν ἐσθῆτα Plb. 11.10.3; also ἀ. ἐντεύξεις Id. 18.49.4; ἀ. ψυχή simple, in good sense, IG 14.1839. Adv. -λῶς, ἔχειν Plb. 38.7.4; μετρίως καὶ ἀ. οἰκεῖν Plu. Pomp. 40; naively, Cic. QF 1.2.3 (prob.); πολλὰ ἀ. πιστεύσας ἀπώλεσεν Vett.Val. 168.23.

children.label: b
children.definition: bold, brazen, AP 5.41 ( Rufin.). Adv. -λῶς, παίζουσα dub. l. in Thgn. 1211; κατηγορίαν ποιήσασθαι Aristid. 2.116J.

simple, not intricate or involved, opp. ἐν κώλοις, περίοδος Arist. Rh. 1409b16: generally, of style, affecting simplicity or artlessness, τὸ ἀ. D.H. Comp. 22; λέξις λιτὴ καὶ ἀ. Id. Dem. 2; φράσις ἰσχνὴ καὶ ἀ. Id. Pomp. 2; λέξις ἀ. καὶ ἄθρυπτος Plu. Lyc. 21; ἀφέλεια -εστέρα Hermog. Id. 2.12. Adv. -λῶς, γράφειν ib. 10.
make an incision, tap a tree, Thphr. HP 9.1.5, 9.2.1 ( Pass.):— Pass., to be ulcerated, f.l. in Hp. Epid. 4.41, Arist. Pr. 889b13; to be abraded, Thphr. CP 5.5.2.
dragging away, Gloss.
one must draw off, Antyll. ap. Orib. 7.21.7.

definition: ἀφέλκω, Ion. ἀπέλκω, fut. ἀφέλξω E. Hec. 142 (lyr.): aor. ἀφείλκῠσα (v. infr.): pf. ἀφείλκῠκα M.Ant. 3.6:—

children.definition: drag away, ἱκέτας ἐκ τοῦ ἱροῦ Hdt. 3.48, cf. S. OC 844, E. Heracl. 113; πῶλον ἀπὸ μαστῶν Id. Hec. 142 (lyr.); τινὰς ἀπὸ τέκνων καὶ γονέων καὶ γυναικῶν Lys. 12.96; drag a speaker from the βῆμα, Pl. Prt. 319c; ἀ. τὰς τριήρεις drag or tow ships away, Th. 2.93, cf. 7.53, 74; draw aside, divert, ἐπὶ τὰ ἡδέα X. Mem. 4.5.6; τὸ δέρμα ἀ. to draw it off, Hp. Art. 11:— Pass., ibid.

data.quote: τινὰς ἀπὸ τέκνων καὶ γονέων καὶ γυναικῶν

children.label: II
children.definition: draw off liquor, κάδων πώματα Archil. 4; θρόμβους οὓς ἀφείλκυσας φόνου A. Eu. 184.
Med., τοῦ δόρατος ἀφελκύσωμαι τοὔλυτρον let me draw off the sheath from . . , Ar. Ach. 1120.
abrasion of plant-stem, Thphr. CP 5.5.3.
hellenize, i.e. civilize thoroughly, τὴν βάρβαρον Ph. 2.567:— Pass., aor. -ηλλήνισθη D.Chr. 37.26.

definition: ἀφελλίαι μέλανος ἀλφός, Hsch. ἄφελμα· τὸ κάλλυντρον, Id.; cf. ὄφελμα.

children.definition: living simply, PMag.Par. 1.1371.
simplicity, unworldliness, Act. Ap. 2.46, Vett.Val. 240.15.
that which is let go: remission of tribute or taxation, LXX 1 Ma. 10.28 (pl.), al., PTeb. 226 (ii B. C.), PFlor. 379.37 (ii A. D.).
free from cajolery, straightforward, Ph. 1.564.

revenue, riches, wealth, abundance, ἄφενος καὶ πλοῦτον ἀφύξειν Il. 1.171, cf. 23.299, Thgn. 30; μύρμηκος Crates Theb. 10.7; of the wealth of the gods, Hes. Th. 112: masc. acc. ἄφενον v.l. in Id. Op. 24: gen. οιο Call. Jov. 96, AP 9.234 ( Crin.); cf. ἄφνος.
abstinence, τινός from a thing, Aret. CD 1.2.
keep off, withhold, Tab.Heracl. 1.131.
incapacity for bearing labour, Eust. 222.28.
incapable of labour, Vett.Val. 77.1, 150.27, Ptol. Tetr. 156, Sch. A.R. 1.269. Adv. -νως carelessly, Simp. in Ph. 43.4.
shut out from, A. Ch. 446 (lyr.).
interpret, expound, τὸ λεχθὲν παρʼ αὐτῶν ἀ. Pl. Sph. 246e: abs., ὡς σὺ κατʼ Αἴγυπτον ἀ. Id. Lg. 660c; translate, Plu. Rom. 21.
dowerless, Hsch. s.v. ἄεδνον.
become a reptile, prob. in Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.69.
change into ἕρπυλλος, Thphr. CP 5.7.2.
to creep off, steal away, S. Tr. 813, OC 490: generally, go away, retire, Id. Aj. 1161, Theoc. 4.29, Herod. 6.98; die, Pempel. ap. Stob. 4.25.52.

definition: ἀφέρτεροι ἥσσονες, Hsch.; but ἀφερτέρους· πολὺ φερτέρους, ταχυτέρους, Id.; cf. ἀφάρτερος.

children.definition: insufferable, intolerable, A. Ag. 386 (lyr.), al.; κακόν Id. Eu. 146 (lyr.).
ἡμέρα holiday, Arist. Ath. 43.3, Aristid. Or. 50(26).98:— also of persons, released from payment, PTeb. 224 (ii B. C.).
Releaser, epith. of Zeus, Arr. ap. EM 176.32, Paus. 1.44.9.

letting go, release, περὶ τῆς τῶν πλοίων ἀφέσεως Philipp. ap. D. 18.77, cf. Pl. Plt. 273c; καρπῶν PAmh. 2.43.9 (ii B. C.); γῆ ἐν ἀφέσει land in private hands, opp. βασιλική, PTeb. 5.37 (ii B. C.), etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: dismissal: in ritual, λαοῖς ἄ. Apul. Met. 11.17; release, Plb. 1.79.12, IG 2.314.21, Ev.Luc. 4.18.

ἀ. φόνου quittance from murder, Pl. Lg. 869d: so abs., Hermog. Stat. 8; discharge from a bond, D. 33.3; ἄ. ἐναντίον μαρτύρων ποιήσασθαι Id. 45.41; opp. ἀπόδοσις χρημάτων, Isoc. 17.29; exemption from attendance, leave of absence, Arist. Ath. 30.6; ἀ. τῆς στρατείας exemption from service, Plu. Ages. 24; remission of a debt, ταλάντου Michel 1340B7 ( Cnidus, ii B. C.); χρημάτων IPE 12.32B70 ( Olbia, iii B. C.); sc. καταδίκης, Inscr.Magn. 93c16.

children.label: b
children.definition: forgiveness, Ev.Marc. 3.29; ἁμαρτιῶν Ev.Matt. 26.28.
relaxation, exhaustion, Hp. Epid. 3.6.
divorce, τινὶ πέμπειν Plu. Pomp. 42.

starting of horses in a race, ἵππων ἄ. ποιεῖν D.S. 4.73: hence, starting-post itself, ἰσώσας τἀφέσει (Musgr. for τῇ φύσει) τὰ τέρματα having made the winning-post one with the starting-post, i.e. having completed the δίαυλος and come back to the starting-post, dub. cj. in S. El. 686, cf. Paus. 5.15.5, 6.20.9: metaph., the first start, beginning of anything, Man. 3.405, etc.
discharge, emission, ὕδατος Arist. PA 697a24; βέλους D.S. 17.41; τοῦ θοροῦ, τοῦ ᾠοῦ Arist. GA 756a12; τοῦ κυήματος Id. HA 608a1; the dropping of a foal, ib. 576a25.

children.label: b
children.definition: discharge, release of an engine, Ph. Bel. 58.24.
Arist. HA 625a20 (pl.).
release, ὕδατος PPetr. 2p.34 (iii B. C.): hence, in concrete sense, conduit, sluice, ib. 3p.88, PFlor. 388.44 (iii A. D.): pl., ἀφέσεις θαλάσσης channels, LXX 2 Ki. 22.16.
reckoning of the vital quadrant, Ptol. Tetr. 127, cf. Vett.Val. 136.2 (but ἀπὸ Λέοντος τὴν ἄφεσιν ποιούμενοι, simply, starting from . . , Id. 31.8).
swarm of bees, Arist. HA 629a9.
supervision of sluices (cf. ἄφεσις 8), PStrassb. 55.8 (ii A. D.).

definition: ἀφεσταίη, 3 sg. opt. pf. of ἀφίστημι.
ἀφεστήξω, Att. intr. fut. from ἀφέστηκα, I

children.definition: shall be absent, away from, τινός Pl. R. 587b; I shall desert, X. An. 2.4.5.
president of the βουλή, GDI 3505.19, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.292a.
feasting, Sch. Pl. Ti. 17b.
far from hearth and home, dub. l. in LXX Si. 37.11.
friendless, Theopomp.Hist. 308; cf. ἀπέταιρος.
one must dismiss, τὴν σκέψιν, τὸ νῦν λεχθέν, etc., Pl. R. 376d, Phdr. 260a, al.
ἀφετέος, έα, έον, to be let go, dismissed, Id. Euthphr. 15d, Phld. Mus. p.89K.
to be ἀφέτης 1.2, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).236.
starting-point, Iamb. Protr. 21.ληʹ.
for letting go, ἀ. ὄργανα engines for throwing stones, etc., J. BJ 3.5.2, cf. 5.6.3.

ἀφετηρία (sc. γραμμή), ἡ, starting-point of a race, CIG 2758iii D 7 ( Aphrodisias), Sch. Ar. Eq. 1156: hence ἀ. Διόσκουροι, whose statues adorned the race-course, Paus. 3.14.7; ἀ. ἕρμα AP 9.319 ( Philox.): metaph., ἀφετήριον πρὸς μάθησιν S.E. M. 1.41; ἀ. ἡ ῥητορική Phld. Rh. 1.223S.
ἀφετηρία· ἀρχή, ἡγεμονία, Hsch.
ἀφετήριον (sc. πλοίων), τό, outlet of a harbour, Str. 11.2.4.
gate of a sluice, PLond. 3.1177.291 (ii A.D.).
one who lets off a military engine, Plb. 4.56.3.

children.label: b
children.definition: teacher of ballistic, IG 2.465.22.

children.label: c
children.definition: starter in races, POxy. 152.1 (vii A.D.).
prorogator, heavenly body which determines the vital quadrant, Ptol. Tetr. 131.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., a freed-slave among the Spartans, Myro 2.
determining the vital quadrant, τόποι Ptol. Tetr. 127.
Ptol. Tetr. 133.

let loose, ranging at large, esp. of sacred flocks that were free from work, ἄ. ἀλᾶσθαι γῆς ἐπʼ ἐσχάτοις ὅροις A. Pr. 666; ἀφέτων ὄντων ταύρων ἐν τῷ . . ἱερῷ Pl. Criti. 119d; νέμονται ὥσπερ ἄφετοι Id. Prt. 320a, cf. R. 498c, Isoc. 5.127, Call. Del. 36.

data.quote: ἄ. ἀλᾶσθαι γῆς ἐπʼ ἐσχάτοις ὅροις
ἀφέτων ὄντων ταύρων ἐν τῷ . . ἱερῷ

children.label: II
children.definition: dedicated, free from worldly business, E. Ion 822, Plu. Amat. 2.768b; [ γένη] ἀπόλυτα καὶ ἄ. Iamb. Myst. 1.8; ἄ. παντὸς τοῦ δεινοῦ Max.Tyr. 3.9.

ἄ. ἡμέραι holidays, Poll. 1.36; νομὴ ἄ. free range, of horses, Plu. Lys. 20; ὁρμαί Ph. 2.380, cf. Plu. Lib.educ. 2.12a; δρόμοι Id. Cleom. 34; ἐξουσία τοῦ λέγειν Phld. Herc. 862.10; κακουργίαι Id. Piet. 21; τὸ ἄ. τῆς κόμης Luc. Dom. 7; τοῦ λόγου Hermog. Id. 1.6. Adv. -τως, ὁρμᾶν freely, Ph. 1.135, cf. Dam. Pr. 307; ἀπολαύει Phld. D. 3 Fr. 89.
rambling, prolix, Luc. Tox. 56.

children.label: III
children.definition: Ἀφέται, pr. n., the place whence the Argonauts loosed their ship, Hdt. 7.193.
fixed, fast, of gilding or silvering, Zos.Alch. p.157B.: —hence ἀφευκτότης, ητος, ἡ, incapacity for sublimation, Olymp. Alch.p.77 B., and ἀφευξία, ἡ, ibid.
deficiency, UPZ 112, PTeb. 8.23 (iii B.C.), BGU 1118.14 (ii B. C.); loss on resale, PPetr. 3p.232 (iii B. C.).
to be deficient, PTeb. 8.19 (iii B.C.).

definition: ἀφεύω, aor. 1 ἄφευσα Semon. (v. infr.), Ar. Th. 590: pf. part. Pass. ἠφευμένος A. Fr. 310: aor. part. ἀφευθείς Suid.:—

children.definition: singe off, ἀφεύων τὴν . . τρίχα Ar. Ec. 13: abs., singe clear of hair, Id. Th. 216, al.:— Pass., καλῶς ἠφευμένος ὁ χοῖρος well singed, A. l.c.
toast, roast, κρέα Semon. 24; φασήλους Ar. Pax 1144.
without a spark of fire, Hsch.
decoction, Dsc. 2.107, Lyc. ap. Orib. 8.25.2, Ruf.ib. 7.26.67, Gal. 13.9.
PPetr. 3p.315, Sch. Lyc. 156.
retire from intercourse, ἀφεψιασάμην, = ἀφωμίλησα, S. Fr. 138; v. ἑψία.
boiled down pitch, Thphr. HP 9.2.5.

definition: ἀφέψω (later ἀφεψ-άω, part. -ῶντες Olymp. in Mete. 164.35), Ion. ἀπέψω:—

children.definition: purify or refine by boiling off the refuse, boil down, καρπόν Hdt. 2.94; τι εἰς τὸ τρίτον Dsc. 5.6; esp. free of dross, refine, χρυσίον καθαρώτατον ἀπεψήσας Id. 4.166; τὸν Δῆμον ἀφεψήσας . . καλὸν ἐξ αἰσχροῦ πεποίηκα Ar. Eq. 1321, cf. 1336:— Pass., ὕδωρ ἀπεψημένον Hdt. 1.188, cf. Hp. Aër. 8, Dsc. 2.107.
boil off, τοῦ ὕδατος μέρος τι Arist. Mete. 359a30:— Pass., ἀφέψεται τὸ ἁλμυρόν Id. Pr. 933b15; τοῦ ὀγδόου μόνον ἀφεψηθέντος Plb. 34.10.12; cf. ἄπεφθος.
lighting, kindling, περὶ λύχνων ἁφάς about lamp- lighting time, Hdt. 7.215, cf. PTeb. 88.12 (ii B. C.), D.H. 11.33, D.S. 19.31, Ath. 12.526c.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἅπτομαι) touch, ἐπώνυμον δὲ τῶν Διὸς γέννημʼ ἁφῶν (Wieseler for γεννημάτων) τέξεις . . Ἔπαφον A. Pr. 850.
sense of touch, Pl. R. 523e, cf. Arist. EN 1118b1, de An. 424a12; ἀκριβεστάτην . . τῶν αἰσθήσεων τὴν ἁφήν Id. HA 494b16; ἡ ἁφὴ ἐν ταῖς αἰσθήσεσι παρέσπαρται Luc. Salt. 70.

data.quote: ἡ ἁφὴ ἐν ταῖς αἰσθήσεσι παρέσπαρται

children.definition: touch of the harp-strings, metaph., ἐμμελοῦς ἁφῆς καὶ κρούσεως Plu. Per. 15; οὐχὶ συμφώνους ἁφάς Damox. 2.42.

grip, in wrestling, etc., ἁφὴν ἐνδιδόναι αὑτοῦ Plu. Util. 2.86f: metaph., τοῖς ἀφληταῖς τῆς λέξεως ἰσχυρὰς τὰς ἁ. προσεῖναι δεῖ καὶ ἀφύκτους τὰς λαβάς D.H. Dem. 18; ἁφὰς ἔχει καὶ τόνους ἰσχυρούς Id. Lys. 13; ἁ. εἶχεν ἡ συνδιαίτησις ἄφυκτον, of Cleopatra, Plu. Ant. 27.

data.quote: τοῖς ἀφληταῖς τῆς λέξεως ἰσχυρὰς τὰς ἁ. προσεῖναι δεῖ καὶ ἀφύκτους τὰς λαβάς

children.definition: sand sprinkled over wrestlers, to enable them to get a grip of one another, Arr. Epict. 3.15.4; ἁφῇ πηλώσασθαι IG 4.955 ( Epid., ii A. D.).
contact of surfaces, etc., Arist. Ph. 227a17, Metaph. 1014b22, al.; point of contact, Euc. Phaen. p.16M., al.; of intersection, Papp. 988.9, cf. Alex.Aphr. in Top. 24.16.
stripes, strokes, LXX 2 Ki. 7.14, al.
infection, esp. of leprosy, ib. Le. 13.6, al.: generally, plague, Aq. Ge. 12.17, Aq., Sm. Ex. 11.1.

children.label: III
children.definition: junction, point of contact in the body, Arist. GC 326b12, 327a12; ligament, Ep.Eph. 4.16, Ep.Col. 2.19.
to be past the prime of life, ἀφηβηκώς Lib. Decl. 23.59; τὴν ἀκμὴν τῶν παθῶν ἀφηβῶντες Ph. 1.516; ἀφηβηκότες κλάδοι Poll. 1.236: pf. part. Pass., Id. 2.10, 18.

lead the way from a point, and so generally, lead the way, go first, Pl. Lg. 760d, etc.; οἱ ἀφηγούμενοι the van, X. HG 4.8.37; ἀ. τῆς ἀποικίας, τῆς ἀγέλης, to be leader of . . , Arist. Fr. 514, Mir. 831a22; πρεσβείας Str. 1.3.1; τῆς σχολῆς D.L. 4.14; τῆς Ἀκαδημείας Phld. Acad.Ind. p.57 M.; ζῴων Porph. Abst. 2.38; οὐκ ἀφηγησαμένῳ δὴ τὸ τέλος ἐγένετο died without ever taking up his command, Phld. Acad.Ind. p.61M.

children.label: II
children.definition: tell, relate, Hdt. 1.24, al., E. Supp. 186; assert, Aret. CA 2.7:— pf. in pass. sense, ἀπήγηταί μοί τι Hdt. 5.62; τὸ ἀπηγημένον what has been told, Id. 1.207, cf. 9.26.
tale, narrative, Hdt. 2.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: guiding, leading, LXX 4 Ma. 14.6.
narrative, λόγος Hermog. Id. 1. 10; σχήματα Aristid. Rh. 1p.500S., cf. D.H. Rh. 1.8. Adv. -κῶς Hermog. Id. 1.1, Procl, in Prm. p.477 S.
Hsch. (prob. should be ἀφηγεμών).

definition: ἀφήγησις, εως, Ion. ἀπήγ-, ιος, ἡ,

children.definition: narration, ἀξιωτάτη ἀπηγήσιος worth telling, Hdt. 2.70; οὐκ ἀξίως ἀ. in a way not fit to be told, Id. 3.125; ἱστορίας D.H. 2.7; πραγμάτων J. BJ 1.11.4, cf. Arr. An.Prooem. 2, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 30, Aristid. 1.154J., Hermog. Id. 1.1, al.; report, SIG 578.54 ( Teos, ii B.C.).
one must explain, Porph. Chr. 94.
guide, κελεύθου AP 14.114 ( -ήτορα cod.).
tending to make, Vett.Val. 15.27.
sweeten, Luc. Am. 3; τὰς ἀκοάς Ph. 1.353:— Pass., τὸ ἦθος Plu. Dio 17.
filter off, Thphr. Lap. 56.
arrive at or have arrived, οἷ πάντα δεῖ ἀφήκειν Pl. R. 530e; ἐς θεούς D.C. 52.4; ἐς πρῖσιν ἀ. is a case for operation, Hp. VC 9.

children.label: II

childhood, nonage, Eust. 1282.24, PLond. 1.113(1).18 (vi A. D.).

definition: ἀφήλικος, ον, = ἀφῆλιξ, PMasp. 6.2 (vi A. D.).
ἀφῆλιξ, Ion. ἀπῆλιξ, ῐκος, ὁ, ἡ,

children.definition: beyond youth, elderly, ἀνὴρ ἀπηλικέστερος Hdt. 3.14, cf. Hp. Mul. 2.120, Alciphr. 1.6; ἀφηλικεστάτην Pherecr. 206: acc. to Phryn. PS p.1 B., only in Comp. and Sup.; but Posit. in h.Cer. 140, Cratin. 369, Phryn.Com. 67 (who used it of young persons, cf. ἀφηλικεστέραν· νεωτέραν, Hsch., and so later Aristobul.Jud. ap. Eus. PE 8.10).

children.label: II
children.definition: minor, infant, in law, POxy. 487.5.
IG 14.1308, Apion ap. J. Ap. 2.2:—hence Adj. ἀφηλῐωτικός, ή, όν, Ptol. Geog. 1.11, Gem. 2.11.

to be absent for a day, μήτʼ ἀ. μήτʼ ἀποκοιτεῖν Decr. ap. D. 18.37, cf. PHib. 148 (iii B.C.), etc.
daily, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.83; πυρετός POxy. 1151.36 (v A.D.).
absent for a day, PGiss. 2.27 (ii B.C.), PTeb. 104.28 (i B.C.), etc. ἀφημιάστους· ἀγροικίας, Hsch.

definition: ἄφημος, ον, and ἀφήμων, ον, ( φήμη)

children.definition: unknown, Hsch.: also Adv. ἀφήμως· ἐν κόσμῳ, ἡσυχῆ, Id., cf. h.Ap. 171ap. Th. 3.104.

refuse to obey the reins, Ph. 1.85, Luc. DDeor. 24[25].1; of persons, turn restive, rebel, Ph. 1.125, al., Str. 17.3.25, Hdn. 1.4.5: c.gen., rebel against, συντάγματος J. BJ 4.7.1, cf. Luc. Bis Acc. 20.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med. or Pass., ἀφηνιάζετο· ἐχωρίζετο, Hsch.

definition: ἀφηνίασις, εως, ἡ, = sq., Hierocl. in CA 16p.456M.

children.definition: refusal to obey the reins, Ph. 1.311 (pl.): metaph., rebellion, ib. 171, al.
refusing the reins, ἵππος Ph. 1.114; rebellious, ib. 337, al.
canonize as a hero, IG 12(3).864, al. ( Thera).

definition: ἀφῆς ἀδύνατος, ἄλαλος ( ἄλλος cod.), Hsch., cf. ἀφεύς; perh. to be read in Call. Hec. Fr. 260.19 Pf. [updated ref.].

children.definition: settle down, be quiet, Hp. Ep. 12, Plb. 2.64.5, CPR 232.4 (ii/iii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: pass over in silence, Ph. 2.3.
archer, epith. of Apollo, Il. 9.404:—the Sch. gives an alternative expl., prophet (from ἀ- copul., and φημί), cf. Orac. in App.Anth. 6.149.7; cf. ὁμοφήτωρ.
an infantile disease, thrush, mostly in pl., ἄφθαι Hp. Aph. 3.24.
Ph. Bel. 94.9: ἅφθας, α, ὁ, Str. Chr. 16.8.
incorruption, immortality, Epicur. Ep. 1p.28U., Phld. D. 3.9, al., LXX Wi. 2.23, Ph. 1.37, al., Ep.Rom. 2.7, Simp. in Cael. 298.16, etc.

children.definition: integrity, sincerity, Ep.Eph. 6.24.
uncorrupted, undecaying, Ph. Bel. 67.37.

children.label: II
children.definition: incorruptible, Epicur. Ep. 1p.29U., al., Phld. D. 3 Fr. 88b, al., Diog.Oen. 63, al.

eternal, Arist. APo. 85b18, Cael. 270a21; immortal, πνεῦμα LXX Wi. 12.1; τὸ πᾶν Ocell. 1.10, D.S. 1.6; ψυχαί D.H. 8.62; θεός Ep.Rom. 1.23; γένος Ph. 1.689; οἱ νεκροὶ ἐγερθήσονται ἄ. 1 Ep.Cor. 15.52; of poems, Μοῦσαι Epigr.Gr. 226.5 ( Teos). Adv. -τως, τιμᾶν ib. 919.10 ( Lycia).
suffer from ἄφθαι, Hp. Nat.Mul. 60, al.
speechless, AB 473.
to be speechless, Poll. 5.146.
without speech, Poll. 5.147.
voiceless, μηνυτήρ A. Eu. 245; στόμα (of a pen) AP 9.162; ἀστράγαλοι ib. 7.427.14 ( Antip. Sid.).
where none may speak, τῷδʼ ἐν ἀφθέγκτῳ νάπει S. OC 156 (lyr.).

children.definition: Pass., unspeakable, unutterable, B. Fr. 2.2, Pl. Sph. 238c. Adv. -τως Iamb. Myst. 7.4.
Hippiatr. 61.
one who eats greedily, Hsch.
of immortal counsel, Orph. Fr. 66.
of undying hatred, Man. 4.234.
not liable to perish, undecaying, imperishable, freq. in Hom. (mostly in Il.) and Trag.:

σκῆπτρον πατρώϊον ἄ. αἰεί Il. 2.46; χρυσέη ἴτυς ἄ. 5.724; καλὸν θρόνον ἄ. αἰεί 14.238; Ἡφαίστου δόμος 18.370; ἄ. ἄμπελοι Od. 9.133; ἄντρον Pi. I. 8(7).41; πυρὸς φέγγος A. Ch. 1037; Γᾶ S. Ant. 339 (lyr.).
immortal, of the gods, h.Merc. 326; Στύξ Hes. Th. 389, 397; of Tantalus, Pi. O. 1.63; ἄ. ὑμνοπόλος, of Anacreon, Simon. 184; ἀφθίτους θεῖναι βροτούς A. Eu. 724; γέννας ἀφθίτου λαχόντες S. Fr. 278.

Ζεὺς ἄφθιτα μήδεα εἰδώς Il. 24.88, Hes. Th. 545; κλέος ἄ. Il. 9.413; ἄ. ὄπις unceasing care, Pi. P. 8.72 (v.l. ἄφθονος) ; ἄ. γνῶμαι unchanging, unchangeable, S. Fr. 414; ἄφθιτα μηδομένοισι Ar. Av. 689.—Poet. and later Prose, δόξα Plu. QConv. 2.723e; prob. in Arist. Caeí. 270a26.
speechlessness, λίθου Callistr. Stat. 9.

voiceless, speechless, h.Cer. 198, Hdt. 1.116; φόβῳ ἄ. A. Pers. 206; ἄ. εἶναι remain silent, Id. Eu. 448; ἄ. ἄγγελος a beacon-fire, Thgn. 549; ἀφθόγγῳ φθεγγομένα στόματι, of an epitaph, Epigr.Gr. 234.4 ( Smyrna).
ἄφθογγα (sc. γράμματα) mutes, Pl. Phlb. 18c, Cra. 424c.

children.definition: Pass., = ἄφατος, not to be spoken of, γάμοι S. Fr. 618 (dub.).
unenvied, A. Ag. 939; beyond the reach of envy, αἶνος Pi. O. 10(11).7.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., bearing no grudge against, τινί ib. 13.25. Adv. -τως Eust. 823.8.
bountiful, BGU 984.27 (iv A.D.).
freedom from envy or grudging, liberality, πᾶσαν προθυμίαν καὶ ἀφθονίαν εἴχομεν ἀλλήλους διδάσκειν Pl. Prt. 327b.

Ap. 24e, cf. 23c; κακῶν Men. 589; ἀφθονίας οὔσης ὀργίζεσθαι abundance of matter for . . , Lys. 12.2; ἀ. ἦν καταπίνειν Telecl. 1.10; τοσαύτην ἀ. κατηγοριῶν D. 21.102; εἰς ἀ. in abundance, X. An. 7.1.33; opp. ἀφορία, Id. Smp. 4.55: pl., καρπῶν ἀφθονίησι Emp. 78.

children.definition: Hsch.
without envy: hence,

children.label: I

ungrudging, bounteous, of earth, ἄφθονε δαῖμον h.Hom. 30.16; ἀφθόνῳ μένει, ἀφθόνῳ χερί, A. Ag. 305, E. Med. 612; ἀ. λειμῶνες Pl. Sph. 222a, cf. Ax. 371c.

Hdt. 6.132, cf. 7.83; χώρη . . ἄ. λίην Id. 2.6; ἄ. βίοτος A. Fr. 196; πόλιν ἀφθονεστάτην χρήμασιν Eup. 307; χώρα πολλὴ καὶ ἄ. X. An. 5.6.25; ἄφθονα καὶ πολλὰ ἔχων εἰπεῖν Aeschin. 3.203; λόγοι ἄ. D. 21.136; ἐν ἀφθόνοις βιοτεύειν to live in plenty, X. An. 3.2.25; ἐν ἀφθόνοις τραφείς D. 18.256; τὸ χαίρειν ἄφθονον εἰπών IG 12(7).445 ( Amorgos).

children.definition: Adv., πάντα δʼ ἀφθόνως πάρα Sol. 38; ἀ. ἔχειν τινός to have enough of it, Pl. Grg. 494c; ἀ. διδόναι Arist. Pol. 1314b4; πολλά με διδάσκεις ἀ. Philem. 154; ξένων καὶ ἐντοπίων ἀ. ζήσας IG 5(2).491 ( Megalop., ii/iii A.D.).
