cure, heal, Archig. ap. Gal. 12.821, Philum. Ven. 5.3, 17.5 ( Pass.), Iamb. VP 25.114, Paul.Aeg. 5.4.
healing, Iamb. VP 15.64 (pl.).
moisten, Arist. HA 637b29 ( Pass.).

definition: ἀφύδιον [ ῡ], τό, Dim. of ἀφύη, Ar. Fr. 507.

children.definition: wash clean:— Med., wash oneself, bathe, καθαραῖς δρόσοις E. Ion 97 (lyr.).
without water, dub. in Hp. Aër. 13.
unfleeing, of the lion, Hes. Fr. 235.

definition: ἀφύη [ ῠ], ἡ (gen. pl. ἀφύων, not ἀφυῶν, Hdn.Gr. 1.425.13),

children.definition: small fry of various fishes (cf. ἀφρός III), Epich. 60, 89, 124, Ar. Ach. 640, Hices. ap. Ath. 7.285b; = μεμβράς, Hsch.; nickname of ἑταίρα, Ath. 13.586b: prov., ἀφύα πῦρ or εἶδε πῦρ ἀ. ‘no sooner said than done’, Zen. 2.32, Eust. 1150.40.—Not used in sg. by Att., acc. to Hsch. s.v. ἀφύων τιμή.

definition: ἀφυής, ές, acc. ἀφυῆ S. Ph. 1014 codd.: ( φυή):—

children.definition: without natural talent, not clever, dull, opp. εὐφυής, πρός τι Pl. R. 455b; οὐκ ἀ. no fool, Id. Lg. 832a; ἀ. πρὸς ταύτην τὴν σκέψιν wanting wit for it, Id. Phd. 96c; ἐς μάθησιν Democr. 85, cf. AP 14.62.
simple, unschooled, S. l.c.

children.label: II
children.definition: naturally unsuited, οὐκ ἀ. πρὸς τὸ φιλοκερδεῖν X. Cyr. 1.6.32; of places, ταῖς δυνάμεσι Plb. 1.30.7; πρός τι Id. 4.38.1 ( Sup.). Adv. ἀφυῶς, διακεῖσθαι πρός τι Id. 1.88.11; ἀ. ἔχειν πρός τι Arist. IA 710a5, Plu. Aem. 2: Comp. -έστερον Anon.Rhythm. Oxy. 9. iii 11.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἀφύη), Ath. 7.324d.

want of natural power or faculty, τῆς κάμψεως Arist. PA 659a29; φωνητηρίων ὀργάνων Str. 14.2.28; ψυχῆς Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.104c; ἀ. πρὸς τὸ ἡδέως ζῆν natural unfitness for . . , ib. Suav. 1088b; in pl., ἀφυΐαι, opp. εὐφυΐαι, Porph. Abst. 3.8, cf. Colot. in Euthd. 2. (Written ἀφύεια in Colot. l.c., Epicur. Nat.Herc. 1420.)
without cosmetics, Hsch.

not to be shunned, δῶρα θεῶν Sol. 13.64; from which none escape, θάνατος Simon. 39.3; χείρ, γυιοπέδαι, Pi. I. 8(7).65, P. 2.41; θεῶν ὄμμα A. Pr. 903; κακῶν τρικυμία ib. 1016; ἄ. κύνες, of the Erinyes, S. El. 1388; of an arrow, unerring, Id. Ph. 105, Tr. 265, E. Med. 634 (lyr.); λαβή Nicoch. 3D.; of a question, admitting no escape, inevitable, Pl. Tht. 165b; λόγος Aeschin. 3.17; ἄφυκτα ἐρωτᾶν Pl. Euthd. 276e; λόγοι ἄ. Ar. Eq. 757: Comp. -ότερος Hp. Acut.(Sp.) 10 (6). Adv. -τως Lyc. 493, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., unable to escape, μέσον λαβὼν ἄ. Ar. Nu. 1047; dub.l. in A. Supp. 784 (lyr.). Adv. -τως LXX 3 Ma. 7.9: Comp. ἀφυκτοτέρως ἂν διακέοιντο Aen.Tact. 16.12.—In codd. freq. written ἄφευκτος, Philem. 115.4, Plu. Lys. 29; ἄφευκτος ἀνάγκη IG 14.803 ( Naples).
bark out, λόγοι ἀφυλακτούμενοι Luc. Am. 17.
to be off oneʼs guard, X. An. 7.8.20, Eq.Mag. 5.15: c. gen., to be careless about, Id. Cyr. 1.6.5:— Pass., to be ill-guarded, Plb. 5.73.10, cf. Onos. 42.15.
unguarded, unwatched, ἀφέντες τὴν ἑωυτῶν ἀφύλακτον Hdt. 8.70, cf. Th. 2.13, 93; ἀ. ἡ τήρησις no watching is sufficient, E. Fr. 162.

children.label: II
children.definition: φυλάσσομαι) unguarded, off oneʼs guard, ἀφυλάκτῳ τινὶ ἐπιπεσεῖν, ἐπιγενέσθαι, Hdt. 9.116, Th. 7.32; πρὸς τὸ ἀδικεῖσθαι Arist. Rh. 1372a19; ἀφύλακτον εὕδειν εὐφρόνην sleep securely through the night, A. Ag. 337; ἀ. τινα λαμβάνειν catch one off his guard, X. Cyr. 1.6.37; ἵνα . . ἀ. ληφθῇ D. 4.18; τὸ ἀ. want of precaution, Th. 3.30: Comp. -ότερος J. AJ 5.7.4: Sup. -ότατος, νυκτὸς ὥρα D.H. 2.38. Adv. -τως X. HG 4.1.17; διακεῖσθαι Plb. 4.36.4; ὁμιλεῖν Phld. Ir. p.30 W.; ῥᾳθύμως καὶ ἀ. D.H. 9.19: Comp. -ότερον ἔχειν Paus. 7.16.2.

against which no precautions are or can be used, not guarded against, Arist. Rh. 1372a24; inevitable, τύχη D.H. 9.25; τὸ πεπρωμένον Plu. Caes. 63; Ἐρινύς Epigr.Gr. 218.7; ἀκωκή IG 12(7).115.7 ( Amorgos); βέλος APl. 16.211 (Stat. Flacc.); Ἔρως ib. 198 ( Maec.).
not protected by a phylactery, PMag.Par. 1.2507.
carelessness in watching, X. Oec. 4.10; negligence, Antipho 3.4.7; absence of guards, X. Hier. 6.4, D.C. 55.15.
strain off, AP 6.191.5 ( Corn.Long.), f.l. in Dsc. 2.76.8.
whey, Hsch. s.v. ὀρὸς γάλακτος.
cleaning out, or ( ὕλη) clearing of brushwood, χωμάτων PColumbia Inv. 56.
without prickles on the leaves, Thphr. HP 6.4.8.
with no ray-florets, ἄνθεμον wild chamomile, Matricaria Chamomilla, var. eradiata, Thphr. HP 7.8.3.
leafless, Il. 2.425, Thphr. HP 1.14.3, Plu. QConv. 2.648f; stripped of leaves, στέφανος Xenarch. 13; ἀ. στόματος λιταί prayers not seconded by the suppliantʼs olive-branch, E. Or. 383.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., stripping off the leaves, blighting, λειχήν A. Eu. 785 (lyr.).
bare of foliage, treeless, πέτρα S. Fr. 299.
without a tribe, Max.Tyr. 21.4, prob. in EM 178.39.

definition: ἀφύξιμος, ον, (ἀφύσσω) κυάθῳ τρὶς ἀ. οἴνην thrice drawn into the cyathus, i.e. 3 cyathi, Nic. Th. 603.

children.definition: drawing out, ladling, dub. in Hsch., Cyr.
awaken from sleep, E. Rh. 25, Plu. Nic. 9, Longus 1.25, etc.:— Pass., wake up, keep awake, Cratin. 306 (lyr.), Pherecr. 191 (lyr.): intr. in Act., Philostr. VA 2.36.
keeping awake, Eust. 1297.31.
awake from sleep, AP 9.517 ( Antip. Thess.), Ant.Diog. 9.

children.label: II
children.definition: fall asleep, Ev.Luc. 8.23, Paul.Aeg. 1.98:— Med., Hld. 9.12 (v.l. ὑφυπνόω).
not kneaded, Hp. VM 14.
unmixed. Adv. -τως Nic.Dam. p.144 D.

definition: ἀφυσγετός ( ἀφύσγετος Tyrannio ap.Sch. Il. 11.495), ὁ,

children.definition: mud and rubbish which a stream carries with it, Il. 11.495, Opp. H. 1.779.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., filthy, ὕδρωψ Nic. Al. 342.
ἀφύσσω) abundant, νέκταρ ib. 584.
not inflated, ἀσκός Hp. Art. 47, 77.
unphilosophical, unscientific, Arist. ap. S.E. M. 10.46.
contrary to the laws of nature, ib. 250.
Nic. Al. 584.
not to be explained by science, Epicur. Fr. 141, 200.

children.label: II
children.definition: without knowledge of natural laws, in Adv. -τως, φαντάζεσθαι prob. in M.Ant. 10.9.
not versed in natural philosophy, prob. l. in M.Ant. 9.41.
drawing off, of liquids, Suid.
without flatulence, Hp. Hum. 3.
causing no flatulence, Diocl. Fr. 128, Gal. 6.540.
expelling flatus, Ruf. Fr. 1, Gal. 12.101.
Tarent.), Hsch.

definition: ἀφύσσω, Ep. impf. ἄφυσσον Call. Cer. 70: fut. ἀφύξω, Dor. -ξῶ Theoc. 7.65: aor. ἤφῠσα Od. 9.165, Ep. ἄφυσσα 2.379, E. IA 1051 (lyr.), imper. ἄφυσσον Od. 2.349:— Med., aor. ἠφῠσάμην, Ep. ἀφύσσατο Il. 16.230:—

children.definition: draw liquids, esp. from a larger vessel with a smaller, νέκταρ ἀπὸ κρητῆρος ἀφύσσων Il. 1.598, cf. Od. 9.9; οἶνον ἐν ἀμφιφορεῦσιν ἠφύσαμεν 9.165; εἰς ἄγγεʼ ἀφύσσαι δῶρα Διωνύσου Hes. Op. 613:— Pass., πίθων ἠφύσσετο οἶνος was drawn from the winejars, Od. 23.305: metaph., ἄφενος καὶ πλοῦτον ἀφύξειν draw full draughts of wealth, i.e. heap it up, τινί for another, Il. 1.171; ἀ. νέκταρ ἐρώτων AP 5.225 ( Paul.Sil.).
sound, probe, ἰητὴρ ἕλκος ἀ. Opp. H. 2.597.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., draw for oneself, help oneself to, οἶνον ἀφυσσόμενος Il. 23.220; ἀπὸ Κηφισοῦ ῥοὰς . . ἀφυσσαμέναν, of Aphrodite, E. Med. 836 (lyr.); φύλλα ἠφυσάμην I heaped me up a bed of leaves, Od. 7.286, cf. 5.482: metaph., αἰῶνος σπειρήματʼ ἀφυσσάμενος App.Anth. 3.186.—Trag. only in E. l.c. and IA 1051.
come too late, be behindhand, Plb. 1.52.8, 21.22.2, D.H. 10.26; ἐὰν ἀφυστερῇ τὸ βαλανεῖον καύμασι PLond. 3.1166.13 (i A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: withhold, LXX Ne. 9.20.
not planted, χῶρος X. Oec. 20.22.

definition: ἀφύτρις ἀρύταινα ( ἅρπαινα cod.), Hsch. (leg. ἀρυστρίς).

children.definition: to become white or bleached, Hp. Int. 40.
whitish, like an ἀφύη, χρῶμα Hp. Mul. 2.110, 116.
not roasted, Dieuch. ap. Orib. 4.7.21, Gal. 12.619.
Theognost. Can. 57.
to be speechless, Hp. Epid. 1.4.13 [1.26.ιγʹ].
unspeakable, unutterable, ἄχος Pi. P. 4.237.

children.label: II
children.definition: voiceless, speechless, παρέσχε φωνὴν τοῖς ἀ. S. OC 1283.
speechlessness, Hp. Epid. 3.17.γʹ, Pl. Smp. 198c.

children.label: II
children.definition: mispronunciation, Philostr. VA 6.36.

voiceless, dumb, Thgn. 669, Hdt. 1.85, D. 18.191; ῥήτωρ Antiph. 196.14; κακὸν ἄ. Com.Adesp. 8 D.; stronger than ἄναυδος (q.v.), Hp. Epid. 3.17.γʹ; εἴδωλα 1 Ep.Cor. 12.2; unable to speak, of a child, Sapph. 118: c.gen., ἄ. τῆσδε τῆς ἀρᾶς unable to utter it, S. OC 865. Adv. -νως ib. 131 (lyr.): neut. pl. as Adv., ἄφωνα σημανοῦσιν . . ὡς . . A. Pers. 819.
with a poor voice, τραγῳδός D.T. 631.21.
intestate, Tab.Heracl. 1.151.

ἄφωνα (sc. γράμματα, στοιχεῖα) consonants, ἄ. καὶ φωνοῦντα (fort. ἄ. φωνήεντα) E. Fr. 578.2; τοῖς ἄλλοις φωνήεσί τε καὶ ἄ. Pl. Cra. 393e; τὸ σῖγμα τῶν ἀ. ἐστί Id. Tht. 203b: but esp. of mutes, τὰ ἄφθογγα καὶ ἄ. Id. Phlb. 18c, cf. Cra. 424c; opp. ἡμίφωνα, Arist. Po. 1456b28, cf. Phld. Po. 2.16, Herc. 994.28, D.H. Comp. 14, D.T. 631.20, S.E. M. 1.102.

data.quote: τοῖς ἄλλοις φωνήεσί τε καὶ ἄ.

definition: ἀφωντεύς, fem. ἀφώντισσα, title of doubtful meaning, BGU 1249 (ii B. C.).

children.definition: not detected, Oenom. ap. Eus. PE 5.20. Adv. -τως Ph. 2.521.
definitively, Arist. Cat. 12b39; separately, specially, Plu. Tranq. 2.466a, Aristid.Quint. 1.21, Artem. 4.84, etc.
without light, Eust. 968.48.

dark, obscure, J. AJ 13.11.2, Arr. Epict. 1.14.10, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.931c, Onos. 10.13, S.E. M. 10.164, Orph. Fr. 272, etc.; ἀ. τοῦ ἡλίου unlit by the sun, Gem. 11.3: metaph., ψυχή Ph. 1.638; φῶς Anon. in Prm. in Rh.Mus. 47.608; σελήνη Nonn. D. 6.91; unenlightened, Plot. 1.2.4.

definition: ἀχά, ἡ, v. sub ἠχέω, ἰαχή.

senses.definition: Hdt. 5.61; also in Boeotia, Plu. Isid. 2.378e; Ἀχέα at Thespiae, IG 7.1867.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀχαιά, ἡ, = ἔριθος, Philet. ap. Gramm. post Orionem p.185S. (Acc. to Hsch. from ἄχος grief for the loss of her daughter: also Ἀχηρώ Id.) Ἀχαΐα, v. Ἀχαιός.

definition: ἀχαίας λύπας, Hsch. ἀχαΐζειν· ἑλληνίζειν, Id.

children.definition: of or for the Achaians, Achaian, A. Ag. 185, 624, E. Tr. 236, al.
the Achaian land, with or without γαῖα, Il. 1.254, 3.75, etc.
γυνή) Achaian woman, Ἀχαιΐδες οὐκέτʼ Ἀχαιοί 2.235, etc.:—also Ἀχαιϊάς, άδος, 5.424, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: = Euphorbia antiquorum, Plin. HN 24.161.
large loaf, baked by the women at the Thesmophoria, Semus 13.
brocket, two-year stag, Arist. HA 611b18: gen. ἀχαιΐνεω AP 6.165 ( Phal.):—also fem. ἀχαΐνη Arist. HA 506a24; also ἀχαιΐνη deer, Babr. 95.87; poet. ἀχαιϊνέη A.R. 4.175, Opp. C. 2.426.

definition: ἀχαιόμαντις, εως, ὁ, title of diviner in Cyprus, Hsch.

children.definition: Achaean, Hom., etc.: hence as Subst.,
Ἀχαιοί, οἱ, the Achaeans, in Hom. for the Greeks generally, Il. 2.235, etc.
Ἀχαΐα, ἡ, Achaia in Peloponnese, Th., etc.; under the Romans, the province of Greece.
Graeco ritu, Orac. ap. Phleg. Mir. 10.
without difficulty, Ph. Bel. 92.15.

unbridled, στόματα E. Ba. 386 (lyr.), cf. HF 382 (lyr.), Ar. Ra. 838, Pl. Lg. 701c; ἀχάλινα λέγειν APl. 16.223; ἀ. ὑπʼ ἀργύρου, i.e. uncorrupted by bribes, IG 9(1).270 ( Atalante): neut. pl. as Adv., E. HF l.c.
unbridled, ἵππος X. Eq. 5.3, D.H. 9.65, Ph. 1.313; στόματα AP 11.177 ( Lucill.); ἀνάγκαι Orph. H. 55.13.
Hippiatr. 11.
without a χαλκοῦς, penniless, ἀ. οὐδός (with a pun on χάλκεος οὐδός) AP 11.403 ( Lucill.).
not forged of metal, πέδαι A. Ch. 493, Critias 20 D.; τρύπανα S. Fr. 708.
to be penniless, AP 11.154 ( Lucill.).
without brass, ὁπλαί Tryph. 87.
without brass, ἄχαλκος ἀσπίδων, i.e. ἄνευ ἀσπίδων χαλκείων S. OT 191 (lyr.).
not brazened: without money, κυνοῦχος AP 6.298 ( Leon.).
immensity, infinite expanse, τοῦ ὀπίσω καὶ πρόσω αἰῶνος M.Ant. 12.7; infinite void, Syrian. in Metaph. 60.5; εἰς ἀ. λήγειν Olymp. in Mete. 82.22; ἡ τοῦ ἀπείρου ἀστάθμητος ἀ. Dam. Pr. 53.
wide opening, cavity, Heliod. (?) ap. Orib. 46.19.12, Paul.Aeg. 6.107.
chest, box, Phanod. 25, Plu. Arat. 6. [ ᾰχᾱ Ar. Ach. ll. cc.]
not opening the mouth, of one mute with astonishment, Hegesipp.Com. 1.25, Plb. 7.17.5, Luc. Icar. 23, Alciphr. 3.20; also διʼ ἀχανοῦς through a narrow opening, Thphr. Vent. 29.

children.label: II
children.definition: yawning, κρημνός Timae. 28; χάσμα AP 9.423 (Bianor), J. AJ 7.10.2; without a lid, Hero Aut. 28.4; wide-mouthed, τεῦχος Diocl. ap. Orib. 5.4.2, cf. Antyll. ib. 44.8.12; open, ἀ. καὶ ἀνώροφος νεώς D.C. 37.17; open, unoccupied, of building land, POxy. 1702.3 (iii A. D.); χάσμα Parm. 1.18; σκότος LXX Wi. 19.17, cf. Lyr.Anon. in PFay. 2ii20; τὸ ἀχανές the yawning gulf, Arist. Mete. 367a19; ἡ ἀ. χώρα Ph. 1.7; ἀχανές· τὸ μὴ ἔχον στέγην . . ἐπὶ τοῦ λαβυρίνθου, S. Fr. 1030; ὄψει πάντα ἀχανῆ PMag.Par. 1.1107.
vast, immense, στράτευμα Plu. Herod. 2.866b; πέλαγος Id. Cic. 6, Jul. Or. 4.142c.

definition: ἀχάντιον, τό, Ion. for ἀκάνθιον, Greg.Cor. pp. 414,649 S.

children.definition: not marked or branded, κάμηλος BGU 13.8 (iii A. D.); not stamped, Ath.Mitt. 33.384 (Pergam.); of ships, without emblem or figurehead, PLille 22.6; not graven or cut, Nonn. D. 13.84; that cannot be cut, σιδήρῳ γυῖα ἀ. ib. 16.158, cf. 26.242.
not palisaded, Plb. 10.11.2, Plu. Mar. 20: metaph., defenceless, friendless, Philostr. VA 5.35. Adv. -τως, αὐλίσασθαι App. BC 3.70.
awkwardness, stupidity, with a play on the name Χαριμόρτης, dub. in Plb. 18.55.2.

definition: ἄχαρις, ὁ, ἡ, ἄχαρι, τό, gen. ιτος, dat. ἀχάρι Hdt. 1.41 codd.:—

children.definition: without grace or charm, συμπόσιον γίνεται οὐκ ἄχαρι Thgn. 496, cf. 1236; of an immature girl, Sapph. 34.

unpleasant, disagreeable, οὐδὲν ἄ. πείσεται Hdt. 2.141, cf. 6.9; πρός τινος 8.143; οὐδὲν ἄ. παριδεῖν τινι 1.38, 108; ἐνδιδόναι οὐδὲν ἄ. 7.52; esp. as euphem. for a grievous calamity, ἄ. συμφορή 1.41, 7.190; τὸ τέλος σφι ἐγένετο ἄ. 8.13; [ βίος] οὐκ ἄ. εἰς τὴν τριβήν Ar. Av. 156.

data.quote: βίος] οὐκ ἄ. εἰς τὴν τριβήν

children.label: II
children.definition: ungracious, thankless, ἄ. τιμή a thankless office, Hdt. 7.36; χάρις ἄχαρις graceless grace, thankless favour, A. Pr. 545 (lyr.), Ag. 1545 (lyr.); κακῆς γυναικὸς χάριν ἄχαριν ἀπώλετο E. IT 566.
show ingratitude, Antipho Soph. 54, Phld. Herc. 1251.17, Hom. p.59O.; πρὸς τοὺς φίλους X. Mem. 2.2.2; τινί Vit.Philonid. p.13 C., Plu. Phoc. 36; τινί τινος D.H. 7.60.
disoblige, τοῖς κακοῖς καὶ νοσώδεσιν ἀ. Pl. Smp. 186c, cf. SIG 495.159 (iii B. C.), Luc. DMar. 9.2, Nic.Dam. p.5 D.
Pass., to be treated ungratefully, Plb. 22.11.8, Corn. ND 16, J. BJ 2.16.4, Plu. Cam. 13, Just. Nov. 98 Pr.; ὑπό τινος Plu. Mar. 28.
ingratitude, X. Cyr. 1.2.7; εἰς ἀ. ἄγειν D. 18.316: in pl., ἀχαριστίαι πρὸς ἀνθρώπους Phld. Herc. 1251.10; ὀλιγωρίας καὶ ἀ. ib. 1457.9.
ungraciousness, ἀρρυθμία καὶ ἀ. Pl. R. 411e.

ungracious, unpleasant, οὐκ ἀχάριστα μεθʼ ἡμῖν ταῦτʼ ἀγορεύεις Od. 8.236: irreg. Comp., δόρπου ἀχαρίστερον (for -ιστότερον) 20.392; without grace or charm, οὐκ ἀχάριστα λέγειν X. An. 2.1.13; φωνή Epicur. Sent.Vat. 75; -ότερον ἐπιμέλημα a more thankless business, X. Oec. 7.37; ἀ. ἐξέτασις D.H. Pomp. 1.

data.quote: οὐκ ἀχάριστα μεθʼ ἡμῖν ταῦτʼ ἀγορεύεις

children.label: II
children.definition: ungracious, unfavourable, Thgn. 841 ( -τως Bgk.), Phld. Ir. p.60 W.

ungrateful, thankless, Hdt. 1.90, X. Cyr. 1.2.7, Crates Theb. 19, etc.; δῆμος Hdt. 5.91; προδότας E. Ion 880 (lyr.), cf. Med. 659 (lyr.); ἀ. πρὸς τοὺς γονέας X. Mem. 2.2.14; τινί E. Hec. 138 (lyr.); σπείρων εἰς ἀχάριστα sowing in thankless soil, IG 14.2012 (Sulp. Max.). Adv. -τως, ἀποπέμψασθαι εὐεργέτας X. An. 7.7.23, cf. Lys. 30.6.
Pass., unrequited, ἀ. εἶναι τὰ ἀνηλωμένα Lys. 21.12. Adv. οὐκ ἂν ἀχαρίστως μοι ἔχοι πρός τινος thanks would not be refused me by . . , X. An. 2.3.18.
Adv. -τως with a bad grace, with an ill will, ἀ. ἕπεσθαι follow sulkily, Id. Cyr. 7.4.14; τὰς χάριτας ἀ. χαρίζεσθαι Isoc. 1.31.
ἀχάριστον, τό, antidote, PGrenf. 1.52.1,12 (iii A. D.), Marcell. Empir.20: also ἀχάριστος, ἡ, Alex.Trall. Febr. 7.

children.label: b
children.definition: eyesalve, Cels. 6.6.7, Gal. 12.749.
unseemly, Plu. Sol. 20; euphem., παθήματα ἀ. ἐόντα μαθήματα γέγονε Hdt. 1.207. Adv. οὐκ -τως ἔφη Ath. 7.281c, cf. Hermog. Id. 2.11, D.C. 66.9.
ungrateful, thankless, δῆμον εἶναι συνοίκημα ἀχαριτώτατον Hdt. 7.156; χάρις ἀ. A. Ch. 42 (lyr., Elmsl.), E. Ph. 1757 (lyr.).

Acharnae, a famous deme of Attica, Th. 2.19 sq.:— Ἀχαρνεύς, έως, ὁ, inhabitant of Acharnae, pl. Ἀχαρνῆς, title of play by Ar.: poet. Ἀχαρνηΐδαι Ar. Ach. 322:— Adj. Ἀχαρνικός, ή, όν, ib. 180; Ἀ. κισσός, = κορυμβίας, Thphr. HP 3.18.6:—also Ἀχαρνίτης, ου, ὁ, κισσός AP 7.21 ( Simm.):— Adv. Ἀχαρνῆσι at Acharnae, Luc. Icar. 18: Ἀχαρνῆθεν from Acharnae, Anaxandr. 41.18.
sea-fish, prob. bass, Callias Com.3: ἄχαρνος in Ath. 3.286b: ἀχάρνας Arist. HA 602a12; gen. ἀχάρνου ib. 591b1:—also ἀχάρνα and ἄχερλα, names of fish in Hsch.
without hiatus, Eust. 919.35.
agate, Thphr. Lap. 31, J. AJ 3.7.5, D.P. 1075, Nonn. D. 5.170.

definition: ἀχεδών, Dor. for ἠχεδών, f.l. in Mosch. 3.54.

children.definition: reed-grass, LXX Ge. 41.2, al.; used for lamp-wick, PMag.Par. 1.1091,1101. (Egyptian word.)
not stormy, βλήχρων ἀνέμων ἀ. πνόαι Alc. 16; not vexed by storms, Μέμφις B. Fr. 22:—also ἀχείμ-αστος, ον, θάλασσα J. AJ 3.5.3:

definition: ἀχείμων, ον, gen. ονος, Nonn. D. 1.142.

children.definition: without hands, ἄποδα καὶ ἄ. [ζῷα] Arist. HA 515b24; ἄ. καὶ ἄποδας [Ἑρμᾶς] Plu. An seni 2.797f, cf. Corn. ND 16; τὰ ἄ. hinder parts, X. Cyr. 3.3.45.
untamed, Ph. 1.680.
not touched by hand, Iamb. VP 29.157.
Batr. 298: metaph., = ἀχρεῖος, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: not made with hands, ἄγαλμα B. 9.11.
want of hands: hence, awkwardness, Hp. Morb. 1.1, Apollon.Cit. 1.
without sleeves, Dialex. 2.9, Sch. Luc. Vit.Auct. 7.
not made by hands, of buildings and statues, Ev.Marc. 14.58, 2 Ep.Cor. 5.1; ἀ. περιτομή, i.e. spiritual, Ep.Col. 2.11.
not elected, D. 19 Arg.ii 13.

children.label: II
children.definition: not granted by vote, τιμή Max.Tyr. 12.5.
untamed, unconquered, Th. 6.10, D.S. 5.15.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀ. φύτευμα, of the olive, not planted by manʼs hand, S. OC 698 (lyr.).

definition: ἀχέλιον τὸ λεπτομερές, Hsch. ἀχέλουρις· ποίμνη τις ( Tarent.), Id.

children.definition: islands at the mouth of the Achelous, A. Pers. 869 (lyr.).
Achelous, name of several rivers, Il. 21.194, 24.616, Hes. Th. 340, Str. 9.5.10, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: any stream: generally, water, S. Fr. 5, E. Ba. 625, Ar. Fr. 351, Achae. 9, Ephor. 27.

definition: ἄχερδος [ ᾰ], ἡ (less freq. ὁ, Theoc. 24.90),

children.definition: wild pear, Pyrus amygdaliformis, Od. 14.10, S. OC 1596, Pherecyd. 33 J., Theoc. l.c.; ἀ. τῆς ἀκραχολωτάτης Pherecr. 164: special kind at Ceos, Arist. Mir. 845a15.
inhabitant of the deme Ἀχερδοῦς: hence with play on ἄχερδος, Crabby, μοχθηρὸς ὢν καὶ τὴν γνώμην Ἀχερδούσιος Com.Adesp. 1277; cf. ἀχραδούσιος.

data.quote: μοχθηρὸς ὢν καὶ τὴν γνώμην Ἀχερδούσιος

children.definition: of Acheron, ναῦς Call. Hec. Fr. 278.3 Pf. [updated ref.]:—also Ἀχερόντιος, E. Alc. 443 (lyr.), Ar. Ra. 471:—fem. Ἀχεροντιάς, άδος, νύξ AP 5.240 ( Paul.Sil.): and Ἀχερούσιος, α, ον (also ος, ον A. Ag. 1160), Th. 1.46:—fem. Ἀχερουσιάς, άδος, X. An. 6.2.2, Pl. Phd. 113a.
white poplar, Populus alba, elsewh. λευκή, Il. 13.389, A.R. 4.1476. (Expld. with ref. to Ἀχέρων, from the legend that it had been brought from the nether world by Hercules, Paus. 5.14.2.)

children.label: II
children.definition: Ἀχερωΐδες ὄχθαι of the river Acheron in Asia Minor, Nic. Al. 13.
Acheron, river in the nether world, Od. 10.513, etc.; of other rivers, Th. 1.46, Str. 6.1.5, etc.

definition: ἀχέτας or ἀχέτᾰ, Dor. and Att. for ἠχέτης (q. v.).
ἀχεύω and ἀχέω (A) [ᾰ], Ep. Verbs used in pres. part.,

children.definition: grieving, mourning, ὀδυρόμενος καὶ ἀχεύων Il. 9.612, Od. 2.23; κεῖτʼ ἀχέων Il. 2.724; ἀχέουσά περ ἔμπης Od. 15.361, cf. Sapph. Supp. 1.11: c. acc., κῆρ ἀχέων grieving in heart, Il. 5.399; θυμὸν ἀχεύων ib. 869, 18.461, Hes. Op. 399: c. neut. Adj., πυκινόν περ ἀχεύων Od. 11.88; μέγʼ ἀχεύων 16.139: c. gen. causae, τῆς ἀχέων sorrowing for her, Il. 2.694, 18.446; Ὀδυσσῆος μέγʼ ἀχεύων Od. 16.139; so ἕνεκʼ ἀλλοτρίων ἀχέων Il. 20.298; τοῦγʼ εἵνεκα θυμὸν ἀχεύων Od. 21.318; later ἐπὶ σφετέροις ἀχέουσα παισί A.R. 3.643.

children.label: II
children.definition: Ep.):

vex, annoy, redupl. aor. 2 ἤκᾰχε (but part. ἀκαχών intr., grieving, Hes. Th. 868): hence redupl. pres. ἀκᾰχίζω, fut. ἀκαχήσω, aor. 1 ἀκάχησα: c. acc. pers., μέγα δʼ ἤκαχε λαόν Il. 16.822, cf. Od. 16.427; ἐμὲ μεγάλως ἀκαχίζεις ib. 432; θανὼν ἀκάχησε τοκῆας by his death, Il. 23.223; ἑ μάλιστα ἤκαχʼ ἀποφθιμένη Od. 15.357; ἀκαχήσεις μηλοβοτῆρας h.Merc. 286.

Pass., ἄχομαι, ἄχνῠμαι, ἀκᾰχίζομαι, imper. ἀκαχίζεο, -ίζεν, Il. 6.486, Od. 11.486: pf. ἀκάχημαι 8.314, Ep. 3 pl. ἀκηχέδαται (with v.l. ἀκηχέαται) Il. 17.637; imper. ἀκάχησο A.R. 4.1324; inf. ἀκάχησθαι Il. 19.335; part. ἀκαχήμενος (accent. as a pres.) ib. 312, Ep. also ἀκηχέμενος 5.364, 18.29: plpf. ἀκαχήατο 12.179: aor. 2, 3 pl. ἀκάχοντο Od. 16.342; opt. ἀκαχοίμην, -οιτο, -οίμεθα, 1.236, Il. 13.344, 16.16, etc.:—in later Ep. pres. ἀκάχονται, impf. ἀκάχοντο, Q.S. 3.224, 5.652:—Constr.: abs., ἄχομαι Od. 18.256, 19.129; ἄχνυται Il. 18.62; ἀχνύμενος, like ἀχέων or ἀχεύων, 1.103, 241, etc.; ἀχνυμένῃ κραδίῃ 24.584; ἀχνύμενος κῆρ 7.428, 431, etc.; ἀκαχήμενος ἦτορ Od. 9.62, etc.; θυμὸν ἀκηχέμεναι Il. 18.29; ἀκαχήατο θυμόν 12.179: less freq. c. dat., ἀκαχίζεο θυμῷ 6.486; also κῆρ ἄχνυται ἐν θυμῷ, ἄχνυτο . . θυμὸς ἐνὶ στήθεσσιν 6.524, 14.38: c. gen. causae, grieve for, sts. with a part., ἀχνύμενός περ ἑταιροῦ, υἷος ἑοῖο, etc., 8.125, 24.550, etc.; σεῖο . . ἀχνύμεθα φθιμένοιο Od. 11.558, cf. 14.376, Il. 16.16; less freq. c. dat., οὔ κε θανόντι περ ὧδʼ ἀκαχοίμην Od. 1.236; ἀχνυμένη περὶ παιδί h.Cer. 77: later c. acc., lament, τὸ δʼ ἄχνυμαι Pi. P. 7.16; ἀχνύμενος μόρον Ἀντιγόνης S. Ant. 627: with part., ὁρόων ἀκάχημαι Od. 8.314, cf. Il. 17.637; μή τι θανὼν ἀκαχίζευ Od. 11.486, cf. Il. 6.486.—Once in Trag., S. l.c.; never in Prose.

data.quote: κῆρ ἄχνυται ἐν θυμῷ, ἄχνυτο . . θυμὸς ἐνὶ στήθεσσιν
οὔ κε θανόντι περ ὧδʼ ἀκαχοίμην

children.definition: utter, h.Cer. 479, prob.l. in h.Hom. 19.18; ἣν ἄτην ἀχέων Hes. Sc. 93 codd.; ὕμνον ἀχέων lonTrag. 39: fut. ἀχήσεται Trag.Adesp. 237.
with undivided hoof, Gal. 2.431.
not barbed, Ph. Bel. 73.43, 75.35.
poor, needy, Theoc. 16.33: dat. pl. ἀχήνεσσιν Epigr. in BCH 11.161 ( Lagina), see also ἠχῆνες, ἀεχῆνες.
need, want, χρημάτων A. Ch. 301; φίλων ἀχηνία Ar. Fr. 20, cf. 1D; ὀμμάτων ἐν ἀχηνίαις in the eyes’ blank gaze, A. Ag. 418 (lyr.).
Suid.

definition: ἄχηρον ἀκρίδα (Cret.), Hsch. Ἀχηρώ, v. Ἀχαία.

children.definition: burdensome, oppressive, of persons, E. Hipp. 94; of things, Id. Hec. 1240; τὸ -ότατον τοῦ βίου X. Mem. 4.8.1; βοοκτασία, i.e. that cost the slayer dear, AP 6.263 ( Leon.). Adv. -νῶς unwillingly, οὐκ ἀ. ὁρᾶν τι X. HG 4.8.27.

children.label: II
children.definition: laborious, βόες IG 14.2012.16 (Sulp. Max.).
load, in aor. part. ἀχθήσας, Hsch.
weight, burden, ἀ. κακοῦ A. Pr. 26.
vexation, annoyance, Th. 2.37, Pl. Lg. 734a; ἐρέσθαι τινὰ διʼ ἀχθηδόνα for the sake of teasing, Th. 4.40; μὴ πρὸς ἀχθηδόνα μου ἀκούσης Luc. Tox. 9.
grievous, κάματος Marc.Sid. 96.
suffering, Man. 4.501.
grievous, dub.l. in Antiph. 94.
D.H. 4.81, Ph. 2.604, D.C. 72.12:—so ἀχθηφόρος, for -οφόρος, Id. 62.6.
load, Ἄραψ κάμηλον ἀχθίσας Babr. 8.1.

definition: ἄχθομαι, Pass.: fut. Med. ἀχθέσομαι Ar. Nu. 865, 1441, Av. 84, Pl. R. 603e, Hp.Ma. 292e; Pass., ἀχθεσθήσομαι And. 3.21, Pl. Grg. 506c, v.l. in X. Cyr. 8.4.10, ( συν-) Aeschin. 3.242: pf. ἤχθημαι Lyc. 827: aor. ἠχθέσθην Hdt. 2.103, A. Pr. 392, Th. 6.15, Isoc. 12.17:—

children.definition: to be loaded, ὅτε δὴ κοίλη νηῦς ἤχθετο Od. 15.457: c. gen., τράπεζα τυροῦ καὶ μέλιτος πίονος ἀχθομένη Xenoph. 1.10: c. dat., ἐλάτην . . ἀχθομένην ὄζοις A.R. 1.1191.

data.quote: τράπεζα τυροῦ καὶ μέλιτος πίονος ἀχθομένη

children.label: II
children.definition: to be vexed, grieved:—Constr.: abs., ἤχθετο γὰρ κῆρ Il. 11.274, cf. A. Pr. 392; ὅτῳ μὴ ἀχθομένῳ εἴη (constr. like ἀσμένῳ, βουλομένῳ ἐστί) X. Cyr. 4.5.21; ἀχθομένην ὀδύνησι Il. 5.354; ἄ. τινί at a thing, or with a person, Hdt. 2.103, 3.1, al., Ar. Ach. 62, Pax 119, Th. 6.28, etc.; μοι μὴ ἄχθεσθε λέγοντι τἀληθῆ Pl. Ap. 31e, cf. Men. 99e: with Preps., ἐπί τινι X. HG 7.1.32, etc.; ἐφʼ ἑκάστου Pl. Prm. 130a; περὶ τῶν νεῶν Hdt. 8.99; ὑπέρ τινος Ar. Lys. 10, Pl. Ap. 23e; διά τινα Isoc. 12.17: also c.acc., λίην ἄχθομαι ἕλκος Il. 5.361: c. neut. Adj., τοῦτο X. An. 3.2.20; μεῖζον Pl. Smp. 216c: c. gen., τῆς οἰκίας Plu. Publ. 10: c. part., either of subject, οὐκ ἄχθομαί σʼ ἰδών τε καὶ λαβὼν φίλον S. Ph. 671, cf. Ar. Pl. 234, Th. 1.92, X. Cyr. 3.3.20, Pl. Prt. 342c, etc.; or of object, ἤχθετο δαμναμένους at their being conquered, Il. 13.352; Ἀρίσταρχον στρατηγοῦντʼ ἄ. Eup. 43: but the part. of the object is also put in gen., οὐδὲν ἤχθετο αὐτῶν πολεμούντων he had no objection to . . , X. An. 1.1.8, cf. Th. 1.95: folld. by a relat. clause, ἄ. εἰ . . , or ἤν . . , E. IA 1413, Th. 8.109, Pl. Hp.Ma. 292e; less freq. ἄ. ὅτι . . Ar. Pl. 899, X. Cyr. 3.3.13, Pl. R. 549c.

data.quote: οὐκ ἄχθομαί σʼ ἰδών τε καὶ λαβὼν φίλον

children.definition: burden, load, Il. 12.452, Hes. Op. 692, Tyrt. 6, etc.; ἄχθεα δυνατώτεραι φέρειν, of camels, Hdt. 3.102, cf. 1.80, Ar. Ra. 9, Th. 4.115; ἄ. οὐκ εὐάγκαλον A. Pr. 352; ἄ. ἀρούρης cumberers of the ground, Il. 18.104, Od. 20.379, etc.; περισσὸν ἄ. γυναικῶν plague of women, S. El. 1241 (lyr.); γῆς ἄλλως ἄχθη Pl. Tht. 176d; ἄ. μυρία γαίης pests, Nic. Th. 9: but φίλτατον ἄχθος, of a corpse, E. Rh. 379 (lyr.): metaph., δίδυμον ἄ. double burden of praise, Pi. N. 6.57.

children.label: II
children.definition: load of grief, χάρμα καὶ ἄ. Hes. Sc. 400; ἀπὸ φροντίδος ἄ. . . βαλεῖν A. Ag. 166; λύπης ἄ. S. El. 120 (lyr.), cf. Ant. 1172; φέρειν ἄχθη κακῶν E. IT 710; ἄ. φέρειν bring or cause sorrow, X. Ep. 1.
bear burdens, Plb. 4.32.7, Plu. Mar. 13; to be loaded, ἡ κοιλία Hp. Acut. 28.
bear as a burden, νέκυν AP 7.468 ( Mel.); κριόν IG 14.1301; ὄστρακον APl. 16.333 ( Antiphil.).
bearing of burdens, βαρῶν Plu. Lat.viv. 2.1130d (pl.), cf. Luc. Asin. 19; μυρμήκων M.Ant. 7.3; any heavy pressure, Hp. Art. 63.
bearing burdens, κτήνεα Hdt. 7.187; ὑποζύγια D.H. 1.85; μύρμηκες Ael. NA 2.25.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., porter, Gell. 5.3.2, Luc. Herod. 5.
not arranged chiastically, περίοδος Sch. Isoc. 8.102. Adv. -τως Jo.Sic. in Rh. 6.343 W.
of Achilles, E. Tr. 39, etc.; poet. Ἀχιλλέϊος Theoc. 29.34: Ion. Ἀχιλλήϊος Hdt. 4.55, 76; used in lyr. by S. Fr. 152:— fem. Ἀχιλληΐς (v. infr.), also Ἀχιλλεῖτις, ιδος, D.L. 1.74.

children.label: II
children.definition: Ἀχίλλειαι κριθαί, a fine kind of barley, Ath. 3.114f; also κριθαὶ Ἀχιλληΐδες Hp. Morb. 3.17; κριθὴ Ἀχιλληΐς Thphr. HP 8.10.2; Ἀ. μᾶζαι cakes of fine barley, Pherecr. 130.4; Ἀχιλλείων ἀπομάττεσθαι (v. sub ἀπομάσσω) Ar. Eq. 819; Ἀχίλλειον, τό, a cake of this sort, Eust. 1414.33.
Ἀ. (sc. σπόγγος), ὁ, fine kind of sponge, used as padding for the inside of helmets, greaves, etc., Arist. HA 548b1 and 20.
Ἀχίλλειος, ὁ, = μυριόφυλλον, Ps.- Dsc. 4.114.

children.label: b
children.definition: Achilles woundwort, Crateuas Fr. 3, Dsc. 4.36, Plin. HN 25.42.

definition: Ἀχιλλεύς, Ep. also Ἀχιλεύς, gen. Ἀχιλλέως (either quadrisyll. or trisyll., as the metre requires, cf. S. Ph. 4, 50 with 57, 364): acc. Ἀχιλλέᾱ ib. 331, 358, voc. Ἀχιλλεῦ: Ep. gen. Ἀχιλλῆος, etc.:—

children.definition: Achilles.

children.label: II
children.definition: ‘Achilles and the Tortoise’, invented by Zeno of Elea, Arist. Ph. 239b14, D.L. 9.29.
without grass, or (with ἀ- intens.) rich in grass, both senses in Hsch. s.v. ἄχειλον.
not snowed upon, Sch. Od. 6.44.

without tunic, i.e. wearing the ἱμάτιον only, of Socrates, X. Mem. 1.6.2; of Agesilaus, Ael. VH 7.13, Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.210b, cf. Aet.Gr. 276c; of Cleanthes the Stoic, D.L. 7.169; of Gelon, ἀ. ἐν ἱματίῳ D.S. 11.26.
want of a cloak or mantle, E. Hel. 1282.
without cloak or mantle, Simon. 167.3, Call. Dian. 115, Lyc. 763; βίος ib. 635.

definition: ἀχλάς, άδος, ἡ, late form of ἀχράς (q.v.), Sch. Theoc. 1.134.
ἄχλοος, ον, contr. ἄχλους, ουν, ( χλόα)

children.definition: without herbage, E. Hel. 1327 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: sere, withered, Opp. H. 2.496.

children.label: III
children.definition: discoloured, Hp. Coac. 596.
dark, gloomy, dismal, δεσμός Epigr. ap. Hdt. 5.77; darkened, καπνῷ ἀ. αἰθὴρ πέλεν A.R. 4.927, cf. Arat. 908, Nonn. D. 9.65, al.; of colour, ἰχώρ Opp. H. 3.163; cloudy, of urine, Ruf. Fr. 79.26.
secret, γάμος Musae. 3.
fringed or bordered with gloom, ἠώς Tryph. 210.
darken, make dim, Aret. CD 1.3:— Pass., become gloomy, grow dark, Thphr. Vent. 35; become dim, Syn.Alch. p.58B.

definition: ἀχλύς, ύος, ἡ, (acc. ἀχλύα Orph. A. 341)

children.definition: mist, Od. 20.357; elsewh. in Hom. of a mist over the eyes, as of one dying, κατὰ δʼ ὀφθαλμῶν κέχυτʼ ἀ. Il. 5.696; as result of ulceration, ἀχλύες Hp. Prorrh. 2.20, cf. Thphr. HP 7.6.2, Dsc. 2.78 (pl.), Aët. 7.27; or in emotion, Ἔρως πολλὴν κατʼ ἀχλὺν ὀμμάτων ἔχευεν Archil. 103; of drunkenness, πρὸς ὄμμʼ ἀ. ἀμβλωπὸς ἐφίζει Critias 6.11 D.; of one whom a god deprives of the power of seeing and knowing others, κατʼ ὀφθαλμῶν χέεν ἀχλύν Il. 20.321; ἀπʼ ὀφθαλμῶν σκέδασʼ ἀχλύν ib. 341, cf. 5.127, 15.668:— personified as Sorrow, πὰρ δʼ Ἀχλὺς εἱστήκει ἐπισμυγερή τε καὶ αἰνή, χλωρή, ἀϋσταλέη Hes. Sc. 264.

data.quote: Ἔρως πολλὴν κατʼ ἀχλὺν ὀμμάτων ἔχευεν
πὰρ δʼ Ἀχλὺς εἱστήκει ἐπισμυγερή τε καὶ αἰνή, χλωρή, ἀϋσταλέη

children.definition: δνοφεράν τινʼ ἀχλὺν . . αὐδᾶται A. Eu. 379 (lyr.), cf. Pers. 668 (lyr.); ἀχλὺν ἀπὸ τῆς ψυχῆς ἀφελεῖν D.C. 38.19; διάνοια ἀχλύος γέμουσα Plu. Aud. 2.42c.

ἀ. ὑγρή liquid emitted by cuttlefish, Opp. H. 3.158.—Mostly poet., but used by Hp. (v. supr.) and Arist. Mete. 367b17, 373b12 (pl.): also in later Prose, Plb. 34.11.15, Str. 6.2.8, and v. supr. 2. [ ῡ in nom. and acc. sg., Hom., Hes.: ῠ in later poets.]
dimming, clouding, Syn.Alch.p.58B.
to be or grow dark, ἤχλυσε δὲ πόντος ὑπʼ αὐτῆς (sc. νεφέλης) Od. 12.406; ὄμματα δʼ αὔτως ἤχλυσαν A.R. 3.963.

children.label: II
children.definition: darken, Q.S. 1.598, Nonn. D. 4.368, Pancrat. Oxy. 1085.12.

hazy, misty, νότοι Hp. Aph. 3.5, Arist. Mete. 367a20; ἀέρες Str. 17.3.8; ἡμέρα App. Syr. 33; κορυφή D.Chr. 1.68; dim, of sight, ὄψις -εστέρα Gal. 16.224; dark, of complexion or appearance, Aret. CA 2.4, SD 2.13.
to be miserable, Alc. 81.
anything that comes off the surface:

children.label: I
children.definition: foam, froth, in Hom. of the sea, Od. 12.238, al.; ἁλὸς ἄ. 5.403, cf. Tim. Pers. 95, A.R. 2.570; θοὴν ἀπερεύγεται ἄχνην, of a river, D.P. 693: Medic., exudation, Hp. Int. 1; οἰνωπὸς ἄ. froth of wine, E. Or. 115; ἄχνα οὐρανία dew of heaven, S. OC 681 (lyr.); δακρύων ἄχνα dewy tears, Id. Tr. 848 (lyr.); also ἄχνη πυρός, i.e. smoke, A. Fr. 336.

children.label: II
children.definition: chaff, in pl., ὡς δʼ ἄνεμος ἄχνας φορέει Il. 5.499; καρπόν τε καὶ ἄχνας ib. 501; down on the quince, μῆλον λεπτῇ πεποκωμένον ἄ. AP 6.102 ( Phil.); ἄχνη ἡ ἀφʼ ἡμιτυβίου fluff, shreds, used for lint, Hp. Art. 37; ὀθονίου Id. Mochl. 2; ἄ. Λυδῆς κερκίδος, of finespun fabrics, S. Fr. 45; ἄ. χαλκίτιδος metallic dust, Plu. QConv. 2.659c, cf. Orph. L. 455; ἄχναι wall-decorations, dub. in Aret. CA 1.1 ( stramina Cael. Aur.).

children.label: III
children.definition: ἄχνην in acc., as Adv., morsel, the least bit, ἢν δʼ οὖν καταμύσῃ κἂν ἄχνην Ar. V. 92.

data.quote: ἢν δʼ οὖν καταμύσῃ κἂν ἄχνην

children.label: IV
children.definition: πυρὸς ἄ., = χαμελαία, Dsc. 4.171; = θυμελαία, ib. 172.

children.label: V
children.definition: ἄχναν· τὴν οἴκησιν, Hsch.

definition: ἄχνημος νῆστις, Hsch. ἀχνητόν· δαψιλές, κτλ., Id.

children.definition: without down, Ἑρμῆς AP 6.259 ( Phil.), cf. 242 ( Crin.), Q.S. 4.431, Nonn. D. 10.180: metaplast. acc. pl. ἄχνοας Man. 1.126.

definition: ἀχνοῦχος, ὁ, dub. sens. in PMag.Leid.W. 8.21 (perh. ‘Lord of the Foamʼ).

children.definition: Call. Fr.anon. 79.
like, of the nature of ἄχνη, Hsch.
lacking gall, Hp. Prorrh. 1.98; lacking a gall-bladder, ἧπαρ ἄ. Arist. HA 506b2; τὰ μώνυχα ἄ. Id. PA 677a33; deficient in bile (with allusion to signf. 2), Plot. 4.4.28.
πόλιος τᾶς ἀχόλω Alc. 37A [348 L.-P.], cf. Plu. Daed. 2 [fr 157 Sandbach].

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., allaying bile or anger, φάρμακον . . νηπενθές τʼ ἄχολόν τε Od. 4.221.
without cartilage, Arist. Spir. 484a29.

definition: ἄχορα τὰ πίτυρα, ἔνιοι δὲ κρανίον, Hsch.

children.definition: without strings, μέλος Poet. ap. Arist. Rh. 1408a6: φόρμιγξ ἄ., metaph. of a bow, Thgn.Trag. 1 (= Lyr.Adesp. 127).
not trained in the dance or chorus, Pl. Lg. 654a; not joining in the dance, Nonn. D. 44.125, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: not attended with the dance, γάμος Musae. 274; esp. in bad sense, ill suiting it, joyless, ὀνείδη S. El. 1069 (lyr.); ἆται E. Tr. 121 (lyr.); φάμα Telest. 1.8.
want of supplies, Plb. 5.28.4, 28.8.6.
without supplies, IG 1(2).187, Arist. EN 1099a33; ἀ. τῶν ἀναγκαίων Id. Pol. 1288b32.
without the dance, epith. of Ares, to mark the horrors of war, A. Supp. 681 (lyr.); of death, μοῖρʼ . . ἄλυρος, ἄ. S. OC 1222 (lyr.); ἄ. στοναχαί v.l. in E. Andr. 1037 (lyr.).
unfed, starving, τύχη Men. 690, Sm. Ps. 58(59).16; = ἄπληστος, Hsch.:—hence Subst. ἀχορτ-ᾰσία, ἡ, ravenous hunger, Sm. De. 28.20.

pain, distress, in Hom. always of mind, ἄχος αἰνόν, ἄλαστον, ἄτλητον, ὀξύ, Il. 4.169, al.; ἄχεος νεφέλη μέλαινα 17.591; ἄχεʼ ἄκριτα 3.412; τὸν δʼ εἷλεν ἄχος κραδίαν B. 10.85; also of physical ills, Pi. P. 3.50 (pl.); δειμάτων ἄχη A. Ch. 586 (lyr.); ἀκοῦ δʼ ἄχος, with a play on the words, S. Tr. 1035; οὐράνιʼ ἄχη A. Pers. 573 (lyr.); ἐμοὶ δʼ ἄχεʼ, ἄχεα κατέλιπε Ar. Ra. 1353 (paratrag.), cf. 1531 (hex.).— Rare in Prose, ἡ παῖς ἀπήγξατο ὑπὸ ἄχεος Hdt. 2.131; ἄ. αὐτὸν ἔλαβεν X. Cyr. 5.5.6, cf. Plu. Cor. 20.

definition: ἀχράαντος [ ρᾱ], ον, poet. for ἄχραντος (q.v.), Call. Ap. 111.

children.definition: of the ἀχράς, ξύλον Dsc. Alex. 23.

definition: Ἀχραδούσιος, formed from ἀχράς, as if the name of a δῆμος,

children.definition: Crabby, Ar. Ec. 362; cf. Ἀχερδούσιος.

definition: ἀχραής, ές, gen. έος, = sq., Nic. Th. 846; ψυχρὸν ἀ.

children.definition: pure cold water, AP 9.314 ( Anyte).

undefiled, immaculate, E. IA 1574, A.R. 4.1025; μίτρη Mosch. 2.73: c. gen., ἡδονῶν M.Ant. 3.4; ἐμψύχου βρώσεως Philostr. VA 6.11; αἵματος Opp. H. 2.648: metaph., τεκμήριον καθαρὸν καὶ ἄ. Pl. Alc. 1.113e; ἄ. ἰδέα Luc. Dem.Enc. 13, cf. Am. 22; οἰκειότητες Jul. Or. 1.9c; τὸ ἄ. δικαστήριον, freq. in Pap., as POxy. 59.10 (iii A. D.); ἄ. πυρί, of a cup, Ion Trag. 1.2, cf. Theoc. 1.60. Adv. -τως Iamb. Myst. 5.9, Procl. in Alc. p.32C.
wild pear, Pyrus amygdaliformis, Telecl. 32, Ar. Ec. 355, Dsc. 1.116; used for the tree as well as the fruit, cf. Arist. HA 627b17 with 595a29, Thphr. HP 1.4.1 with CP 2.8.2; cf. ἄχερδος.

definition: ἄχρατοι οἱ πολέμιοι, Hsch. ἀχρέα· βλάσφημον, κτλ., Id.

children.definition: rubbish, Sch. E. Hec. 159.
untimely-laughing, epith. of the Athenians, Cratin. 323, cf. AB 475.
rendering useless, Eust. 217.38.

definition: ἀχρεῖος ( Att. ἄχρειος acc. to Hdn.Gr. 1.136), ον, also α, ον IG 7.303.10 ( Oropus), Dsc. 4.5, Polem.Phgn. 69: Ion. ἀχρήϊος:—

children.definition: useless, unprofitable, ἀχρήϊος ἀνήρ Hes. Op. 297; ἐπέων νομός ib. 403; δέμας A. Pr. 365, cf. Hp. Int. 39; οἰκητήρ S. OC 627; opp. εὐγενής, Id. Fr. 667; ἐρινὸς ἀ. ὢν ἐς βρῶσιν ib. 181; ἀ. κοὐ σοφός E. Med. 299; δοῦλος Ev.Matt. 25.30; οὐκ ἀπράγμονα ἀλλʼ ἀχρεῖον νομίζομεν Th. 2.40; λόγον ἀχρεῖον ἀπέρριψαν Ant.Lib. 11.3: Comp. -ότερος, ὄρνιθες Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.195: c. inf., unfit to do, ἀ. πράττειν τι Pl. R. 371c: c. dat., ἀ. τοῖς σώμασι Agatharch. Fr.Hist. 3, cf. Them. Or. 26.326a.

unfit for war, ἀ. ὅμιλος Hdt. 3.81; τὸ ἀ. τοῦ στρατοῦ the unserviceable part of an army, Id. 1.191; οἱ ἀχρειότατοι Th. 1.93, 2.6, cf. X. HG 7.2.18; τὸ ἀ. τῆς ἡλικίας Th. 2.44. Adv. -είως, ἔχειν πρὸς ναυμαχίαν App. BC 5.84.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀχρεῖον, as Adv., twice in Hom., ἀχρεῖον ἰδών giving a helpless look, looking foolish, of Thersites after being beaten, Il. 2.269; ἀχρεῖον δʼ ἐγέλασσε laughed without cause, made a forced laugh, of Penelope trying to disguise her feelings, Od. 18.163; ἀχρεῖον κλάζειν bark without need or cause, Theoc. 25.72.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. ἀχρείως γέλασόν με (cf. ἀχρειόγελως) APl. 16.86, cf. Them. Or. 33.367b: neut. pl. as Adv. ἀχρεῖʼ ἀσπαίροντος helplessly, Euph. 44.
unprofitableness, worthlessness, LXX To. 4.13.

definition: ἀχρειόω or ἀχρεόω ( OGI 573.16), pf. ἠχρείωκα:—

children.definition: render useless, disable, damage, Dicaearch. 2.3, Plb. 3.64.8, LXX Da. 4.11, OGI l.c.:— Pass., ἀχρεῶσθαι SIG 569.31 ( Crete, iii B.C.), cf. Plb. 1.14.6, BCH 35.286 ( Delos, ii B.C.); to be corrupted, LXX Ps. 13(14).3; διʼ ἀπειρίαν ἠχρειώθησαν Apollon.Cit. 1.1.
free from debt, i.e. undiminished, δύναμις PMag.Par. 1.527.
Arch.Pap. 7.10, Tryph. 125.
v.l. in Man. 4.76:—also ἀχρήϊστος, ον, Musae. 328, Nonn. D. 24.266. ἀχρήϊος, ον, Ion. for ἀχρεῖος.
to be without money, Hsch. s.v. πένεται.
want of money, Th. 1.11, D.H. 7.24, Eus.Mynd. 7.

definition: ἀχρημάτιστος [ μᾰ], ον, ἡμέρα ἀ. a day

children.definition: on which no public business was done, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.273e, cf. Sch. Luc. Tim. 43.

children.label: II
children.definition: disused, φρέαπ PMag.Lond. 46.345.

children.label: III
children.definition: Sammelb. 2276.

children.label: IV
children.definition: unprofitable, bringing no advantage, τόποι Antioch.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(3).106; of planets, Vett.Val. 5.8.
without money or means, Hdt. 1.89, Timocl. 9.7; ἀ. τὴν πόλιν ποιεῖν Arist. Pol. 1271b16; μήτʼ ἀχρημάτοισι λάμπειν φῶς on the poor, A. Pers. 167.
to be in want of money, Poll. 6.196.
want of money, Od. 17.502, Thgn. 156.
poor, needy, Sol. 13.41, Pi. Fr. 218; once in Trag., E. Med. 461.
disuse, non-user, Anon. in Rh. 17.37.
useless, ἐν ἀ. διαθέσει CPHerm. 119r iv9 (iii A. D.), cf. Sopat. in Rh. 8.10 W., Hippiatr. 14.
uselessness, Gloss.
not to be in use, Sch.D.T.p.195H.
to be useless, S.E. M. 1.259.
uselessness, unfitness, Hp. Praec. 9, Pl. R. 489b, AP 15.38 ( Comet.), Them. Or. 26.326a.

children.label: II
children.definition: non-usance of a thing, Pl. R. 333d, Plu. Sanit. 2.135c.
to speak unprofitably or amiss, EM 463.25.

useless, unprofitable, μετάνοια Batr. 70; νέες Hdt. 1.166; ἄ. ὁ ὀφθαλμὸς γίνεται Hp. Prorrh. 2.19; οὐκ ἄ. ἥδʼ ἡ ἄνοια Th. 6.16; χρεομένῳ ἄχρηστα useless if you try to use them, Hp. Art. 14; πεσεῖν ἄ. θέσφατον without effect, E. IT 121; ἄ. ἐς πόλεμον Hdt. 8.142, Lycurg. 53; πρός τι Arist. HA 560b14: c. gen. rei, ἄ. τῶν ἔργων Id. Oec. 1345a35; ἄ. τινι useless to a person, Hdt. 1.80, cf. X. Oec. 8.4 ( Sup.); τῇ πόλει E. Heracl. 4; τὸ διηπορηκέναι οὐκ ἄ. Arist. Cat. 8b24.

useless, do-nothing, D. 19.135 ( Comp.), etc.; ἄ. πολῖται Is. 7.37; σοφισταί prob. l. in Lys. 33.3; non-effective, unwarlike, Eun.Hist.p.239D.; so (with a pun— not having received an oracle) Ath. 3.98c. Adv. -τως, ἔχειν πρός τι D. 61.43.

children.label: II
children.definition: unkind, cruel, θεοί Hdt. 8.111; λόγος Id. 9.111.

children.label: III
children.definition: Act., making no use of, c. dat., ξυνέσει τʼ ἄχρηστον τῇ φύσει τε λείπεται E. Tr. 672.

data.quote: ξυνέσει τʼ ἄχρηστον τῇ φύσει τε λείπεται

children.label: IV
children.definition: not used, i.e. new, ἱμάτια Luc. Lex. 9, Ath. 3.97e.
obsolete, Eust. 118.25, Sch.rec. S. El. 132.
not to be used, unseemly, EM 463.26.
make useless, Horap. 1.50; corrupt, τὴν Ἑλλάδα φωνήν Eust. 367.40.

children.label: I
children.definition: Adv. to the uttermost, τένοντε καὶ ὀστέα λᾶας ἀναιδὴς ἄχρις ἀπηλοίησεν Il. 4.522; ἀπὸ δʼ ὀστέον ἄχρις ἄραξε 16.324, cf. 17.599.

data.quote: καὶ ὀστέα λᾶας ἀναιδὴς ἄχρις ἀπηλοίησεν

children.definition: Hom., before Preps., ἄχρι εἰς Κοτύωρα X. An. 5.5.4; ἄ. ἐς ποταμόν Tab.Heracl. 1.17; ἄχρι πρὸς τὸν σκοπόν, πρὸς τὴν πόλιν, Luc. Nigr. 36, Herm. 24; ἄχρις ἐπʼ ἄκνηστιν A.R. 4.1403; ἐπʼ ὀστέον IG 12(7).115.9 ( Amorgos); ἄχρι ἐπὶ πολὺ τῶν πλευρῶν Thphr. Char. 19.3; ἄχρις ἐς ἠῶ Q.S. 6.177; ἄχρι ὑπὸ τὴν πυγήν Luc. DMort. 22[27].4: less freq. after the Noun, ἐς τέλος ἄχρις Q.S. 2.617, cf. Nonn. D. 5.153, etc.: rarely c. acc., ἄχρι . . θρόνον ἦλθεν IG 14.2012 (Sulp. Max.): with an Adv., ἄχρι πόρρω still farther, Luc. Am. 12; ἄχρι δεῦρο S.E. M. 8.401.

children.label: II
children.definition: even to, as far as,

until, ἄχρι μάλα κνέφαος until deep in the night, Od. 18.370; ἄχρι τῆς τήμερον ἡμέρας D. 9.28; ἀπὸ τῆς ἀρχῆς ἄχρι τῆς τελευτῆς Id. 18.179; ἄχρι γήρως Apollod.Com. 2; ἄχρι δὲ τούτου until then, Sol. 13.35; ἄχρι τοῦ νῦν Timostr. 1, Ep.Rom. 8.22; ἄχρι νῦν Luc. Tim. 39, LXX Ge. 44.28; ἄχρι παντός continually, Plu. Cic. 6.

data.quote: ἀπὸ τῆς ἀρχῆς ἄχρι τῆς τελευτῆς

children.definition: as far as, even to, ἄχρι τῆς ἐσόδου τοῦ ἱροῦ Hdt. 2.138 (who elsewh. has μέχρι) ; ἄ. τῆς ὁδοῦ IG 1(2).893; ἄ. τῆς πυλίδος SIG 2587.25; ἄ. τοῦ Πειραιῶς D. 18.301; ἔδακνεν ἄχρι τῆς καρδίας Com.Adesp. 475; ἄχρις ἥπατος Ti.Locr. 101a, cf. 100e; ἄχρι τῆς πόλεως D.H. 2.43; ἄ. τοῦ δεῦρο Gal. 10.676: after its case, ἰνίου ἄχρις Euph. 41.
ἄχρι τούτου up to this point, D. 23.122; ἄχρι τοῦ μὴ πεινῆν X. Smp. 4.37; ἄχρι τοῦ θορυβῆσαι D. 8.77; ἄ. θανάτου Act.Ap. 22.4; ἄχρι τῆς πρὸς τὸν πλησίον δοξοκοπίας Polystr. p.19 W.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἄχρι, ἄχρις with or without οὗ,

until, so long as, ἄχρι οὗ ὅδε ὁ λόγος ἐγράφετο X. HG 6.4.37; ἄχρις ὅτου Epigr.Gr. 314.24 ( Smyrna); ἄχρι οὗ ἄν or ἄχρι ἄν with Subj., ἄχρι ἂν σχολάσῃ till he should be at leisure, X. An. 2.3.2; ἄχρις οὗ ἂν δοκέῃ Hp. Fist. 3; ἄχρις ἂν αἱ ἡμέραι παρέλθωσιν Id. Int. 40; ἄχρι ἂν ἔχῃ τὸ ἴδιον ἐντελές [ἡ ἱστορία] Luc. Hist.Conscr. 9: without ἄν, ἄχρις ῥεύσῃ Bion 1.47; ἄχρι οὗ τελευτήσῃ (v.l. -σει) Hdt. 1.117; ἄχρι οὗ ἐπιλάμψῃ Plu. Aem. 17; ἄχρι ἄν, c. inf., Epist. Mithr. in SIG 741.37: c. inf. only, ἄχρις ἱκέσθαι ὀστέον Q.S. 4.361.

data.quote: ἄχρι οὗ ὅδε ὁ λόγος ἐγράφετο

children.definition: so far as, διώξας, ἄχρι οὗ ἀσφαλὲς ᾤετο εἶναι X. Cyr. 5.4.16: c. subj., αὐξάνεται εἰς μῆκος, ἄχρι οὗ δὴ ἐφίκηται τοῦ ἡλίου Thphr. HP 5.1.8; cf. μέχρι throughout. — Ep. poets use ἄχρι or ἄχρις, as the metre requires: in Ion. μέχρι is preferred (v. supr.): but ἄχρι, -ις are more common in Hom. than μέχρι: the only Att. forms are ἄχρι, μέχρι, before both consonants and vowels, cf. Phryn. 6, Moer. 34; and so in Att. Inscrr. (where it is somewhat less freq. than μέχρι): ἄχρι ἄν with hiatus in IG 2.2729, Hegesipp.Com. 1.26; but ἄχρις Men. Sam. 179.—Never in Trag. ( ἄχρι, = ṃṃ-χρι, cf. μέχρι.)

data.quote: διώξας, ἄχρι οὗ ἀσφαλὲς ᾤετο εἶναι
αὐξάνεται εἰς μῆκος, ἄχρι οὗ δὴ ἐφίκηται τοῦ ἡλίου

children.definition: to be colourless: to be discoloured, ill-coloured, Hp. Fract. 25, Sor. 2.43.
absence of colour, Plot. 2.4.10.
loss of colour, paleness, Hp. Prorrh. 2.24, Arist. Pr. 967a8; opp. εὔχροια, Thphr. Sud. 39.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀ- copul.) likeness in colour, Hsch.
without time, instantaneous, Gal. 7.448; ἡ ἄ. φύσις Dam. Pr. 404; short-lived, of infants, Ptol. Tetr. 125, cf. Placit. 5.18.6.

independent of time, S.E. M. 10.225; non-temporal, ἄ. πᾶσα ἡ νόησις Plot. 4.4.1. Adv. -νως timelessly, Alex.Aphr. in Mete. 129.5, in Sens. 135.14, Procl. Inst. 124, Herm. in Phdr. p.159 A.; instantaneously, Ph. 1.571, al., Them. Or. 15.196b.
not wasting time, Hsch.
colourless, Arist. de An. 418b27, Nic. Th. 236, Ocell. 2.3, Plot. 2.4.12.

children.label: II
children.definition: ill-complexioned, pallid, opp. εὔχροος, Hp. Aër. 6, VC 19, Arist. Pr. 966b35, al.: Comp. ἀχρούστερος Hp. Prorrh. 2.4, Arist. HA 584a14: also -οώτερος Hp. Vict. 2.63.
ἄχροοι· πυρραὶ ἡμίονοι, Hsch.; also ἄχροον· πονηρόν· Λάκωνες νόθον, Id.
without gold, ἄ. καὶ ἀνάργυροι Pl. Lg. 679b, cf. Ath. 6.231e.
uncoloured, Arist. Mete. 371b9, 377b1, Thphr. Od. 31. Adv. -τως [ Lib.] Decl. 30.5.
colourless, Pl. Phdr. 247c, Plu. Mult. 2.97b, etc.
unblushing, shameless, Suid. s.v. ἄχρωμος.
= foreg. 2, Hp. Epid. 7.122, Artem. 4.44: Comp., οὐδὲν -ότερον Hierocl. Facet. 203:—hence Subst. ἀχρωμία, ἡ, Gloss.
Hp. Epid. 7.85, Pl. Chrm. 168d, Arist. Metaph. 989b9.
untouched, ἄ. γόνατα χερῶν ἐμῶν E. Hel. 831.

children.label: II
children.definition: uncoloured, colourless, Democr. ap. Plu. Col. 2.1111a.
PMag.Par. 1.3010, cf. PMag.Berol. 1.7 ( -τως Pap.).
āḥū, quill-cassia, Dsc. 1.13.
insipidity, Diocl. Fr. 138 (pl.).
without juice, insipid, Thphr. CP 6.19.4, Xenocr. 18, Diocl. Fr. 138: Comp., Ath.Med. ap. Orib. 1.2.14.
not converted into chyle, διαχωρήματα Gal. 7.446, cf. 6.575.
without flavour, Arist. Metaph. 989b10, Sens. 443a11, Xenocr. 45; tasteless, of water, Thphr. CP 6.3.1.
far-spread, copious, ὕδωρ Nic. Al. 174.
fleawort, Plantago Psyllium, Thphr. HP 7.11.2, Plin. HN 21.89, 101.
for the conveyance of chaff, prob. for ἀγυρα-τωγά, Hsch. s.v. σαργάναι.
Theb.Ostr. 106.
carry chaff, BGU 698.22 (ii A. D.), 14 iii 17 (iii A. D.).
on chaff, Sammelb. 1092.
fed by chaff, φλόξ Plu. QConv. 2.658d.
Tab.Heracl. 1.139 sq.
of chaff, dub. in AP 9.438.5 ( Phil.).
heap of chaff, Il. 5.502, AP 9.384.15.
consisting mainly of chaff, ἀμητός Arat. 1097.
barn for chaff, PHamb. 23.18 (vi A. D.), Ael.Dion. Fr. 88.
chaff-holder, X. Oec. 18.7.

definition: ἀχυροθήκη, ἡ, = foreg., PLond. 5.1768 (vi A. D.), PMasp. 279.18 (vi A. D.), Sch. Il. 5.202.
ἄχυρον [ ᾰ], τό, mostly in pl. ἄχυρα,

children.definition: chaff, bran, husks left after threshing or grinding, Hdt. 4.72, Pherecr. 161, Antiph. 226.2, X. Oec. 18.1; ἐν τοῖς ἀ. κυλινδομένην Hermipp. 47: sg., Thphr. HP 8.4.1, Ev.Matt. 3.12, etc.: prov., ὄνος εἰς ἄχυρα ‘pig in clover’, of unexpected good fortune, Philem. 188, cf. Ar. Fr. 76: metaph., ἄχυρα τῶν ἀστῶν, of μέτοικοι, Id. Ach. 508; ἄχυρα ἀπὸ τοῦ τοίχου ἀποσπᾶν, of dying persons, Hp. Prog. 4.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄ. χρυσοχοϊκά slag from gold-smelting, PHolm. 5.7.
supply of chaff, Arch.Pap. 4.116 (iii A. D.).
collector of chaff (or of the tax thereon), Ostr. 1012 (ii A. D.).
chaff-heap, Eup. 299, Ar. Fr. 10D., Pl. Com. 6, and in the best Mss. of Ar. V. 1310: but ἀχυρμός should be read.
threshing out the husks, τρίβολοι AP 6.104 ( Phil.).

mix chaff or straw with mud, Thphr. HP 4.8.8:— Pass., μᾶζαν ἠχυρωμένην mixed with chaff, Polioch. 2; πηλός ἠχ. IG 2(2).463.18; ἠχ. ἀμόργῳ Ph. Bel. 86.44; to be strewn with straw, of the orchestra, Arist. Pr. 901b30.
like chaff, chaffy, Arist. Pr. 928a20 ( Sup.); θρίσσαι Hices. ap. Ath. 7.328c; of an eruption, f.l. in Hp. Liqu. 6.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀχυρῶδες, = ἄχυρον, Dsc. 2.93.
storehouse for chaff, IG 11(2).287 A 149, al. ( Delos, iii B. C.), Gp. 6.2.8.
mixing of chaff with mud or straw, compared with the swallowʼs nest-building, Arist. HA 612b22.
unbathed, unanointed, Nonn. D. 9.25.
insoluble, τὰ ἀ. Gal. 17(2).45.
Hsch.
scurf, dandriff, Ar. Fr. 410, etc. ( ἀχώρ, ῶρος, in Alex.Trall. 1.8, Paul.Aeg. 3.3, Dsc. 1.33, al., cf. Phryn. PS p.8 B., AB 475, after the analogy of ἰχώρ, ῶρος, but ἄχωρ acc. to Hdn.Gr. 2.937.)
suffer from ἄχωρ, in part. ἀχωροῦντας or -ιῶντας, prob. cj. for ἰχωρροοῦντας in Paul.Aeg. 3.3.
to be inseparable, Phld. D. 3.9.
inseparability, Phld. Mus. p.94K.
not parted, undivided, Pl. R. 524c; inseparable, Arist. EN 1102a30, de An. 427a2; ἀρετὴ ἀ. ἡδονῆς Epicur. Fr. 506, cf. Ep. 3p.64U., Gal. 16.521, al. Adv. -τως Phld. Sign. 20.

children.label: II
children.definition: χῶρος) without a place assigned one, X. Lac. 9.5.
without resting-place, homeless, Ael. Fr. 77; εἴ τι μέλλει ἐργάζεσθαι, ἀνόνητα γένοιτο καὶ ἄχωρα Tab.Defix. 97.11, cf. 96.17.

data.quote: εἴ τι μέλλει ἐργάζεσθαι, ἀνόνητα γένοιτο καὶ ἄχωρα

children.definition: like ἄχωρ, ἐξανθήματα Aët. 8.15, v.l. in Hp. Liqu. 6.
not heaped up, Hld. 9.3.

definition: ἄψ, Adv. of Place, ( ἀπό, Lat. abs)

children.definition: backwards, back again, freq. in Hom., mostly with Verbs of motion, freq. before ἐς, ἀπό, ἐκ, ἂ. ἐς Ὄλυμπον ἵκεσθον Il. 8.456, cf. 10.211, etc.; with trans. Verbs, ἂ. ἐς κουλεὸν ὦσε 1.220, cf. 15.418; ἂ. ἐπὶ νῆας ἔεργε 16.395; ἂ. ἵππους στρέψαι 13.396, cf. 18.224.

data.quote: ἐς, ἀπό, ἐκ, ἂ. ἐς Ὄλυμπον ἵκεσθον

children.definition: again, in return, ἂ. διδόναι Il. 22.277; ἂ. ἀφελέσθαι 16.54; ἂ. ἀπολύειν 6.427; ἂ. ἀρέσαι 9.120; ἂ. τέτατο ὑσμίνη 17.543; ἂ. ἐπιμισγομένων 5.505; [ ἂψ ἀπαγγ] εῖλαι prob. in Epich. 99; ἂ. λαμβάνειν, = ἀναλαμβάνειν, Theoc. 25.65: pleon., ἂ. αὖτις yet again, Il. 8.335, 15.364; ἂ. πάλιν 18.280.

definition: ἀψαλᾷ ἀψοφητὶ πορεύεται, Hsch., Cyr., Zonar.

children.definition: untouched, unhandled, S. Fr. 550.
scot-free, Crates Com. 46, Ar. Lys. 275.
without sand, not sandy, Hsch.
leave untouched, σώμασι App. Gall. 14:— Pass., Poll. 1.9.
without touching, Plu. QConv. 2.665f.
want of contact, Iamb. in Nic. p.57P.
untouched, Hdt. 8.41, Thphr. HP 5.5.6, Ph. 2.14; not to be touched, sacred, Th. 4.97; χρήματα App. BC 2.41.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not touching, c. gen., ἄ. ἔγχους S. OT 969; ἄ. τέκνων, of persons dying young, Epigr.Gr. 241.2 ( Smyrna).
blameless, S. El. 497 (lyr.). Adv. ἀψεγέως A.R. 2.1022.
not disapproved, Gal. 17(2).184.
Alc. Supp. 26.11, Hsch., Zonar.
truthfulness, Corinn. Supp. 2.70, Pl. R. 485c, Iamb. Protr. 20; reliability, of times and seasons, Arist. Mu. 397a11:
not to lie, to speak truth, πρός τινα S. Tr. 469, Aeschin. 2.95: abs., Ar. Fr. 751; not to err, Pl. Tht. 199b; περί τι Arist. SE 165a25.

children.label: II
children.definition: observe faithfully, IG 5(2).343.38,57 (Orchom. Arc., iv B. C.).

without deceit, truthful, esp. of oracles and the like, Hes. Th. 233, Hdt. 1.49, 2.152 ( Sup.), al.; μάντις ἀ., of Apollo, A. Ch. 559, cf. Fr. 350.5, Cratin. 29 D. ( Sup.); θεός Ep.Tit. 1.2; ἀψευδεῖ τέχνῃ, of augury, A. Th. 26; ἦθος E. Supp. 869; unerring, Pl. Tht. 160d, etc.; μάρτυς -έστατος Ph. 2.341.
uncorrupt, pure from all deceit, ἀ. πρὸς ἄκμονι χάλκευε γλῶσσαν Pi. P. 1.86.
ἀψευδής, = κώνειον, Ps.- Dsc. 4.78.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -δέως, Att. -δῶς, really and truly, οἱ ἀ. ἄριστοι Hdt. 9.58, cf. Ph. 1.19, al., Iamb. Myst. 2.2: Sup. -έστατα, ἐρεῖν Ph. 1.34.
of no false diviner, τέχνη Nicoch. ap. Lex.Sabb.
ἀψευδέω, Plb. 3.111.8; πρός τινα Phalar. Ep. 123.
ἀψευδής, Ph. Fr. 51 H.; νόμος Plu. Art. 28; unfeigned, πένθος AP 7.638.6 ( Crin.). Adv. -τως PMag.Lond. 121.248.
neglect, Hsch.
free from care, S. Fr. 692.
untanned, κόθορνος Ar. Lys. 658; uncombed, χαῖται A.R. 3.50.
not tried or tested, Plb. 8.19.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: untouched, Hsch.; gloss on ἄψαυστος, Id.
not having voted, Ar. V. 752.

children.label: II
children.definition: not voted for, unwelcome, πενία ἀ. οὐσία Secund. Sent. 10.
without a stone, δακτύλιος Artem. 2.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hsch.
not having yet voted, Plb. 6.14.7.
arched, vaulted, D.C. 68.25; wheel-shaped, Eudox. Ars 19.13.
to be tied in a circle or curve, δικτύοις μόλυβδον ἡψιδωμένον AP 6.90 ( Phil.).
vaulted, Gloss.
with tyres, τροχός Edict.Diocl. 15.32.
heart-touching, M.Ant. 9.3.
rapid satiety, Plb. 14.1.4, Plu. Garr. 2.504d, Andronic.Rhod. p. 572 M.; fickleness, δίχα ὕβρεως καὶ ἁ. PLond. 5.1711 (vi A. D.).

quickly sated: hence, fickle, Pl. Ax. 369a; ἁ. πρὸς τὰς ἐπιθυμίας οἱ νέοι Arist. Rh. 1389a6, cf. D.Chr. 32.28, Ph. 2.312, al.; ποικιλώτατος καὶ ἁ. βίος Posidon. 41: τὸ ἁ., = ἁψικορία, Plu. Cor. 4, Luc. Cal. 21. Adv. -ρως Ph. 1.214, Hsch.

data.quote: ἁ. πρὸς τὰς ἐπιθυμίας οἱ νέοι

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., quickly sating, χάρις Plu. Aud.poet. 2.20b; λόγος Lib.educ. ib. 7b.
skirmish with an enemy, Hyp. Fr. 131, Plb. 18.8.4, D.S. 11.52; entice or lead on to fight, Plu. Crass. 10, Dio 39.

skirmishing, D.S. 20.29, Plu. Brut. 39, al.: metaph., altercation, ῥητόρων Aeschin. 2.176, cf. Hyp(?). Oxy. 1607.1i26, Plb. 5.49.5, Plu. Lyc. 2, PPetr. 3p.104: pl., ἁ. χειρῶν personal encounters, D.H. 6.22; λόγων τε καὶ ἔργων ib. 34.
Alex.Aphr. de An. 185.26. Adv. -χως provocatively, D.H. 6.59.
trivial and transient enmity, Hsch., Suid.
draught of wormwood, Aët. 3.69, Alex.Trall.1.15: —also ἀψινθάτιον (leg. -ιᾶτον) PLond. 3.1259.32 (iv A. D.).
flavoured with wormwood, ἔλαιον Alex.Trall. 1.15.

wormwood, Artemisia Absinthium, Hp. Morb. 3.11, Mul. 1.74, X. An. 1.5.1, Thphr. HP 1.12.1, Dsc. 3.23; ἀψινθίῳ κατέπασας Ἀττικὸν μέλι Men. 708:—also ἄψινθος, ἡ, Aret. CD 1.13, but ὁ, Apoc. 8.11; and ἀψινθία, ἡ, Alex.Trall.1.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀψίνθιον, = ἀβρότονον, Ps.- Dsc. 3.24.
= Artemisia monosperma, Aq. Pr. 5.4.
ἀ. θαλάσσιον, = σέριφον, Dsc. 3.23.
prepared with wormwood, Dsc. 3.23.

definition: ἀψίον τὸ πρόσωπον, Hsch. ἀψίορ· μέγα, πλατύ, πολύ, ἰσχυρόν, Id.
ἁψίς, Ep. and Ion. ἀψίς, ῖδος, ἡ, ( ἅπτω)

children.definition: loop, mesh, such as form a net, ἀψῖσι λίνου Il. 5.487; ἁψῖδες nets, A.R. 3.138, Opp. H. 4.146.
felloe of a wheel, Hes. Op. 426, Lyr. in PLG 3.740; the wheel itself, Hdt. 4.72, E. Hipp. 1233; κύκλος ἁψῖδος the potterʼs wheel, APl. 16.191 ( Nicaenet.).
dowel-pin, IG 11(2).161 A 70 ( Delos, iii B. C.).
disk, τὴν ἡμερίαν ἁψῖδα, of the sun, E. Ion 88; segment cut off by rainbow, Arist. Mete. 371b28, cf. Poet. ap. Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.103f.

arch or vault (cf. ψαλίς II), ἐπὶ τὴν ὑπουράνιον ἁψῖδα Pl. Phdr. 247b, cf. Suid. s.v. αἰθεροβατεῖν, Epigr.Gr. 1078 ( Adana), IGRom. 3.975, PMag.Lond. 46.41; κατὰ τὴν ἁψῖδα ποτώμενος Luc. Bis Acc. 33; triumphal arch, D.C. 53.22, 26, etc.: metaph., κάμπτειν ἐπῶν ἁψῖδας Ar. Th. 53.

children.label: b
children.definition: σελάνας ἐς δεκάταν ἁψῖδα in the moonʼs tenth orbit, i. e. the tenth month, Hymn.Is. 38.

children.label: c
children.definition: ἡ ἀνωτάτω ἁ. θεάτρου uppermost tier, D.C. 61.17. ( ἅψῐδα in late Poets, Epigr.Gr. 440.9,445.4.)

definition: ἅψις, εως, Ion. ιος, ἡ, ( ἅπτομαι)

children.definition: touching, Hp. Epid. 7.5; contact, Pl. Prm. 149a, Arist. HA 621a11: pl., Pl. Prm. 149c.
ἅ. φρενῶν distraction of mind, Hp. Acut. 52.
blameless, Sammelb. 625, Poll. 3.139. Adv. -γως Eust. 19.17.

definition: ἄψοος θηρίον τι κατεσθίον ἀμπέλους, Hsch.
ἀψόρροος, ον, contr. ἀψό-ρρους, ουν, ( ἄψ, ῥέω)

children.definition: back-flowing, refluent, Homeric epith. of Ocean, regarded as a stream encircling the earth and flowing back into itself, Il. 18.399, Od. 20.65.

going back, backwards, ἄψορροι κίομεν Il. 21.456; ἄψορροι προτὶ Ἴλιον ἀπονέοντο 3.313; ἐκ δόμων ἄ. . . περᾷ S. Ant. 386, cf. OT 431: mostly in neut. ἄψορρον as Adv., backward, back again, ἄψορρον . . ἔβη Il. 7.413; ἄ. οἱ θυμὸς ἀγέρθη 4.152; ἄ. προσέφην Od. 9.282; ἄψορρον ἥξεις A. Pr. 1021, cf. S. El. 53; ὦ παῖδες, οὐκ ἄψορρον (sc. ἄπιτε); ib. 1430; οὐκ ἄ. ἐκνεμῇ πόδα; Id. Aj. 369 (lyr.). (For ἄψ-ορσος, cf. παλίν-ορσος.)
juncture, joint, λύθεν δέ οἱ ἅψεα πάντα all his joints were relaxed [by sleep], Od. 4.794, cf. Nic. Al. 541; ἅψεα δεσμοῦ Opp. H. 3.538: in pl., limbs, AP 5.217 ( Agath.), al.
Adv. of sq., Pl. Tht. 144b, D. 25.90, Arist. HA 533b32, Men. 298, Ph. 1.643; λέξις ὥσπερ ἔλαιον ἀ. ῥέουσα D.H. Dem. 20.
noiseless, c. gen., ἀ. κωκυμάτων without sound of . . , S. Aj. 321.
noiselessness, Arist. Ph. 244b17, Plot. 2.1.6.
S. Tr. 967 (lyr.), E. Tr. 887, Com.Adesp. 1310, Arist. de An. 420a7. Adv. -φως and -φέως EM 183.22.
without pustules or pimples, σῶμα Dsc. 2.72.
Hsch.
not capable of being cooled, Pl. Phd. 106a.
not rejoicing the heart, Plb. 9.1.5. Adv. -τως without being comforted, Jul. Or. 8.252a.

definition: ἀψυχεί, Adv. of ἄψυχος, Hdn. Epim. 257.

children.definition: swoon, Hp. Morb. 2.5, Epid. 7.1.
swooning, syncope, Hp. VM 10, Coac. 222.

children.label: II
children.definition: want of spirit, faint-heartedness, A. Th. 259, 383, E. Alc. 642, etc.
making lifeless or faint, Eust. 611.5.

lifeless, inanimate, πόθῳ Archil. 84; μνημεῖʼ ἄψυχʼ ἐμψύχων Simon. 106.4, cf. E. Fr. 655, Tr. 623; λωτὸς ἄ. ἔμπνουν ἀνίει Μοῦσαν Sopat. 10; ἃ -ότατα τῶν ὀστῶν with least life or sensation, Pl. Ti. 74e, cf. Arist. de An. 413a21, etc.; ἄ. θεοί, of statues, Timae. 127.
ἄ. βορά non-animal food, E. Hipp. 952.

children.label: II
children.definition: spiritless, faint-hearted, κάκη A. Th. 192; ἀνήρ Trag.Adesp. 337: ἀψυχότεραι αἱ θήλειαι [ἐλέφαντες] Arist. HA 610a21; of style, lifeless, D.H. Dem. 20. Adv. -χως Poll. 2.227.

children.label: III
children.definition: materialistic, λόγος Porph. Gaur. 14.4 ( Comp.).
blow, only in impf. ἄεν, A.R. 1.605, 2.1228.
hurt, contr. from ἀάω (q. v.); cf. ἄτη.

definition: ἄω (C), Ep. inf. ἄμεναι: fut. ἄσω Il. 11.818: aor. 1 subj. ἄσω 18.281, inf. ἆσαι (v. infr.): aor. 2 subj. 1 pl. ἕωμεν 19.402:— Med., Ep. 3 sg. ἄᾰται Hes. Sc. 101; cf. ἆται· πληροῦται, Hsch.: fut. ἄσομαι Il. 24.717: aor. ἀσάμην 19.307:—

children.definition: satiate, w. acc. and gen. αἵματος ἆσαι Ἄρηα to give him his fill of blood, 5.289, cf. 9.489, 18.281, al.; w. acc. and dat. Il. 11.818, w. acc. only, ib. 24.211:
administer liberally, Nic. Th. 676, Al. 305, 331.

children.label: II
children.definition: take oneʼs fill of a thing, ἱεμένη χροὸς ἄμεναι 21.70; λιλαιομένη χροὸς ἆσαι ib. 168, cf. 15.317; γόοιο μὲν ἔστι καὶ ἆσαι 23.157:— Med., ἄσεσθε κλαυθμοῖο 24.717; ποτῆτος ἄσασθαι φίλον ἦτορ 19.307. (Root sā: sə, cf. ἄ-ατος, ἅ-δην.)
without smell, Thphr. Od. 18, Plu. An.procr. 2.1014f.
to be free from pain, Hsch.

definition: ἀῶθεν, Adv., Dor. for ἠῶθεν, Theoc. 15.132.

children.definition: = 2 cubic πήχεις, PPetr. 2p.14, al. (iii B. C.):—also αὐωΐλιον, ib. p.118.

definition: ἀώιος, for ἠῷος, ἀστήρ Ion Lyr. 10, prob. in B. Fr. 3.11.
ᾀών, ᾀόνος, ἡ, Dor. for ἠϊών, v.l. in Mosch. 3.122.

children.definition: fish, Epich. 63.

children.label: II
children.definition: garment, PAmh. 2.3aii 21 ( iii A. D., pl.).
to be careless ( ἀ- priv., ὤρα), Hsch., Suid.:—also, = φυλάττειν ( ἀ- intens.), Hsch.

definition: ἀωρί ( -εί PFay. 19.2 (ii A. D.)), Adv. of ἄωρος,

children.definition: at an untimely hour, too early, Heraclid.Com. 1.2, Luc. Bis Acc. 1, AP 12.116; ἀ. θανάτῳ ἀπέθανεν Ar. Fr. 663 cod.; νυκτὸς ἀωρί at dead of night, Theoc. 11.40, 24.38; ἀωρὶ τῶν νυκτῶν Antipho 2.1.4, 2.4.5; ἀωρὶ νύκτωρ (v.l. νυκτῶν) Ar. Ec. 741, Phalar. Ep. 141.2.

wrong time: hence, untimely fate or death, Hld. 10.16; but ἀωρίη old age, Herod. 3.29; bad condition, πραγμάτων Procop. Arc. 14: pl., ἀωρίαι bad seasons, Plu. Isid. 2.371b; ἀωρία midnight, dead of night, Pherecr. 6D., Ael. Fr. 81; in full, ἦν ἀ. τῆς νυκτὸς μεσούσης Alciphr. 3.47: metaph., ἀωρίῃ τοῦ πρήγματος Aret. CD 1.4; darkness (figure of calamity), prob. in LXX Is. 59.9: acc. as Adv., ἀωρίαν ἥκειν to have come too late, Ar. Ach. 23; ποῦ βαδίζεις ἀωρίᾳ; whither so late? Luc. Asin. 24.
an early bather, better written divisim in M.Ant. 1.16.8.
Thphr. CP 2.2.2, Arat. 1076, AP 7.600 ( Jul.Aegypt.); ἀὥριος IG 1(2).980: nom. pl. fem. ἀώριαι Ἐφ.Ἀρχ. 1911.59 ( Peraea, iv B. C.).
devouring those who die untimely, PMag.Par. 1.2867.
untimely dead, Ar. Fr. 663 (cj. Dind. for ἀωρὶ θαν., cf. Phryn. PS p.42B.).

definition: ἀωροθανής, ές, = foreg., CIG 3846q ( Aezani), Calder Philadelphia and Montanism 35.

children.definition: unnaturally smooth, esp. men who by pulling out their beards tried to make themselves look young, Cratin. 10; of a youth, beardless, Ael. NA 13.27.
dying untimely, IG 12(8).444 ( Thasos).
at midnight, ἀ. ἀμβόαμα ἔλακε A. Ch. 34 (lyr.).

untimely, unseasonable, χειμών, τύχαι, A. Pers. 496, Eu. 956 (lyr.); θάνατος E. Or. 1030; τελευτή Antipho 3.1.2; ξυνουσίη Aret. CD 1.4 (but ἄ. γάμος too late, D.H. 4.7); πένθος LXX Wi. 14.15; μετὰ μάχην ἱκετεύειν ἄωρον ἐδόκει J. BJ 5.11.1; ἄ. θανεῖν E. Alc. 168, cf. Hdt. 2.79; οἱ ἄ. those who die untimely, Apollod.Com. 4, cf. Philostr. VA 6.4; esp. of those dying unmarried, PMag.Par. 1.342, cf. 2725; in Epitaphs, ὤλετʼ ἄ. IG 1(2).977: Sup. ἀωρώτατε (sic) Sammelb. 1420; ἕνεκα χρόνου πάντες ἐσμὲν ἄ. unripe (for death), Metrod. 52; ἀώροις περιπέσοιτο συμφοραῖς Epigr.Gr. 376 ( Aezani): Comp. γήρως ἀωρότερα πράττειν things unbecoming old age, Plu. Sull. 2.
unripe, of fruit, Dsc. 1.126, LXX Wi. 4.5; of fish, out of season, opp. ὥριμος, Nicom.Com. 1.21: metaph., ἄωρος πρὸς γάμον Plu. Lyc. 15; ἄ. ὥρα Id. Comp. Thes.Rom.6.
without youthful freshness, ugly, Eup. 69, X. Mem. 1.3.14 ( Sup.), Pl. R. 574c. Adv. -ρως J. AJ 4.8.19.

πλεκτάναι or polypus-like legs of Scylla, τῆς ἦ τοι πόδες εἰσὶ δυώδεκα πάντες ἄωροι Od. 12.89; one of the Sch. expld. it as κρεμαστοί, ἀπὸ τοῦ αἰωρῶ, but more prob. = ἄκωλοι, as Sch.HQ, from Ion. ὤρη B.

data.quote: τῆς ἦ τοι πόδες εἰσὶ δυώδεκα πάντες ἄωροι

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄωροι πόδες fore-feet, οὐ τοὺς ἀώρους εἶπά σοι . . πόδας πρίασθαι; σὺ δὲ φέρεις ὀπισθίους Philem. 145.

data.quote: οὐ τοὺς ἀώρους εἶπά σοι . . πόδας πρίασθαι; σὺ δὲ φέρεις ὀπισθίους

children.definition: sleep, Sapph. 57; ἤλασʼ ἄωρον prob. for ἤλασας ὦρον in Call. Fr. 150.
untimeliness, immaturity, dub. in Epigr.Gr. 414.
laid prematurely, of soft-shelled eggs, Hippiatr. 22.

definition: ἄωρτο, Ep. plpf. Pass. of ἀείρω.
Ἀώς, ἡ, Dor. for Ἠώς, Ἕως; ἐπʼ ἀϝῶ c. gen.,

children.definition: to east of, Mnemos. 42.332 ( Argos, iv B. C.).

sleep, Ep. Verb, only pres., τί πάννυχον ὕπνον ἀωτεῖς; Il. 10.159; μηκέτι νῦν εὕδοντες ἀωτεῖτε γλυκὺν ὕπνον Od. 10.548: abs., Simon. 37.5:—in Hsch., ἀωτεύειν· ἀπανθίζεσθαι (also ἀωτεῖτε· ἀπανθίζετε τὸν ὕπνον), but expld. by ὑφαίνειν, AB 476, cf. Suid. s.v. ἀωτεμεῖν (sic); perh. to be read (in signf. sleep) in B. 8.13 for ἀσαγεύω.

data.quote: μηκέτι νῦν εὕδοντες ἀωτεῖτε γλυκὺν ὕπνον

children.definition: cull the choicest or best; v. λωτίζομαι.

definition: ἄωτον [ ᾰ], τό, and ἄωτος, ὁ,

children.definition: the choicest, the flower of its kind: in Hom. mostly of the finest wool, οἰὸς ἄωτον Il. 13.599, 716, Od. 1.443; without οἰός (which must be supplied from the context), flock, down, 9.434; once of the finest linen, λίνοιό τε λεπτὸν ἄωτον Il. 9.661; of the golden fleece, χρύσεον ἄωτον A.R. 4.176, cf. Orph. A. 1336; ἄκρον ἄωτον [ὕδατος], of pure water, Call. Ap. 112; of the foam on a wave, κύματος ἄκρῳ ἀ. Id. Hec. Fr. 260.57 Pf. [updated ref.]; μέλιτος ἄ. γλυκύς Pi. Pae. 6.59: freq. in Pi., ἄ. ζωᾶς the prime or flower of life, Id. I. 5(4).12; ἄ. στεφάνων the fairest of . . , ib. 6(5).4, cf. O. 5.1; Χαρίτων ἄ. their fairest gift, Id. I. 8(7).16; σοφίας ἄκρος ἄ. the choicest gift of minstrelʼs art, ib. 7(6).18; ἄ. γλώσσας, i.e. a song, ib. 1.51; ὕμνων Id. P. 10.53; δίκας ἄ. Id. N. 3.29; Ἀφροδίτας . . ἄωτον A. Supp. 666 (lyr.): rarely in pl., στεφάνων ἄωτοι Pi. O. 9.19; ἡρώων ἄωτοι Id. N. 8.9; ῥόδων ἄωτοι Simon. 148: in Epitaphs, θνῄσκω . . ἀκμᾶς ἐν ἀώτῳ in the flower of youth, IG 3.1328; τὸν . . ἄωτον τοῦ δήμου CIG 2804, cf. Epigr.Gr. 455.

children.label: II
children.definition: that which gives honour and glory to a thing, ἄ. ἵππων a song in praise of horses, Pi. O. 3.4; χειρῶν ἄ. ἐπίνικον Id. O. 8.75.—The gender is indeterminate in Hom. and A.; Pi. always has ἄωτος, and so Theoc. 13.27; A.R. and later Ep. ἄωτον ( Opp. C. 4.154, οἰὸς ἄωτα in pl.).
without ears, Plu. Sollert. 2.963b; of vessels, without lugs, Philet. ap. Ath. 11.783a, dub. in Call. Fr. 115, cf. Aët. 1.138.
